original: bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: de ni skye ba'i kun nas 'ching ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /

analyzed: ci ste 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes pa nyid spangs na'ang /

analyzed: de'i tshe lta ba nyid spangs par khas len pa na /

original: srid pa gang las yin te /
analyzed: srid pa gang las yin te /

analyzed: thob pa nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: bde bar gyur pa'am sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig ces 'dod pa'i srid pa'i gnas skabs /

analyzed: 'di la nga zhes blo gang de sems can la lta ba lhan cig skyes ba yin par 'dod do //

analyzed: de yang srid pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: gang gi phyir / 'ga' zhig nga zhes mthong med pa //

original: bdag la chags par byed pa min //
analyzed: bdag la chags par byed pa min //

analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la phyin ci log ba'i blo nyid bdag la chags pa yin no //

original: gang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: gang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa des ni /
translated: One who is attached to a self

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes ba ma spangs pa yin te dper na so so'i skye bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes ba ma spangs pa yin te dper na so so'i skye bo lta bu'o //
translated: has not abandoned the innate view of the transitory collection. For example, it is like an ordinary person.üîΩEven though a stream-enterer and so on are attached to a self, they have abandoned the view of the transitory collection.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a syllogistic reason based on nature.

original: gal te bdag bcings pa dang grol ba 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag bcings pa dang grol ba 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If there is no one who is bound or liberated,

original: ji ltar 'ching ba dang thar ba grub pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ching ba dang thar ba grub pa yin /
translated: how can bondage and liberation be established?

original: sbyor ba ni 'ching ba gang yin pa de ni bcings pa la brten pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'ching ba gang yin pa de ni bcings pa la brten pa can yin te /
translated: Bondage is that which binds, and it is dependent on the bound.

original: dper na lha sbyin lcags sgrog gis bcings pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin lcags sgrog gis bcings pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Devadatta is bound by the fetters.

original: 'khor ba yang 'ching ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang 'ching ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And cyclic existence is bondage. This is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: gang dang gang thar ba yin pa de ni grol ba la brten pa can yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang thar ba yin pa de ni grol ba la brten pa can yin te /
translated: Liberation is that which liberates, and it is dependent on the liberated.

original: dper na lha sbyin lcags sgrog las thar ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin lcags sgrog las thar ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Devadatta is liberated from the fetters.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang thar pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang thar pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And nirvana is liberation. This is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: de bas na bcings pa dang grol ba 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: de bas na bcings pa dang grol ba 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: Therefore, others think that bondage and liberation must exist.

original: de la gtan tshigs de gnyes ni ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs de gnyes ni ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But these two reasons are not established.

original: 'di ltar bcings pa dang grol ba 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcings pa dang grol ba 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, there is no such thing as bondage or liberation.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod na 'du byed nas 'khrul pa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod na 'du byed nas 'khrul pa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, if ignorance exists, then the formations and so on up to the delusion occur.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mass of suffering alone arises, which is devoid of a self and what belongs to a self.

original: de bas na 'di ni 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni 'khor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is samsara.

original: ma rig ba 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa nas sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni thar pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig ba 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa nas sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni thar pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of the formations and so on up to the cessation of the mass of suffering alone, which is due to the cessation of ignorance, is liberation.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi 'ching ba dang thar ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi 'ching ba dang thar ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, bondage and liberation do not exist for a self.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'ching ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'ching ba yin par brjod do //
translated: Thus, the cause of the origination of suffering is described as bondage.

original: rtag pa'i de ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i de ste /
translated: The cessation of the cause is liberation.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig la yang nus pa med pa'i phyir gang las yin sbyor ba ni gang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid ma yin pa de ni 'ching ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig la yang nus pa med pa'i phyir gang las yin sbyor ba ni gang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid ma yin pa de ni 'ching ba ma yin te /
translated: Because the cause of the origination of suffering alone is not capable of bondage, the syllogism is: That which is not the cause of the origination of suffering is not a bondage,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: bdag kyang sdug bsngal @86b skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang sdug bsngal @86b skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the self is not the cause of the origination of suffering. This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: 'di ma grub pa yin par bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ma grub pa yin par bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: This should not be thought of as unestablished.

original: skabs gzhan dag tu rtag pa'i rnam par byed pa po nyid ma yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs gzhan dag tu rtag pa'i rnam par byed pa po nyid ma yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has already been demonstrated in other contexts that it is not a permanent creator.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'ching bas bcings par 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'ching bas bcings par 'gyur na yang /
translated: Even though one might be bound by the bondage as explained,

original: sdug bsngal mi skye rgyu nyid ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye rgyu nyid ni //
translated: the cause of the nonorigination of suffering

original: gang yin pa de thar pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yin pa de thar pa yin no //
translated: is liberation.

original: rtag pa de ste sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i rgyu nyid 'ching bar ma grub pa'i phyir gang las yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa de ste sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i rgyu nyid 'ching bar ma grub pa'i phyir gang las yin te /
translated: Since it is not established that a permanent cause of the nonorigination of suffering is bondage, from what is it liberated?

original: ma yin pa de ltar na log pa'i rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa de ltar na log pa'i rtog pa yin no //
translated: If it is not so, then it is a false conception.

original: rgyas par de dag ni rang gi sde pa bstan bcos mdzad pa gzhan gyis mang du bshad zin pa'i phyir ma spros so //
analyzed: rgyas par de dag ni rang gi sde pa bstan bcos mdzad pa gzhan gyis mang du bshad zin pa'i phyir ma spros so //
translated: Since these have been extensively explained by other masters of our school, I will not elaborate.

original: gal te rtag pa las 'ching ba dang thar pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar ni 'dod pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa las 'ching ba dang thar pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar ni 'dod pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: If it is said that ‚ÄúBondage and liberation do not exist in the permanent, and that is accepted,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa'i gang zag bcings pa dang thar par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa'i gang zag bcings pa dang thar par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: but bondage and liberation are accepted in the person who is inexpressible as permanent or impermanent,‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gnyi ga'i rnam par ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rnam par ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no entity that is not of both kinds.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te /
translated: Permanence and impermanence are mutually exclusive,

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the character of abiding.

original: dngos po la gcig rnam par gcad pa dang / yongs su gcod pa dag ni de las gzhan yongs su gcod pa dang / rnam par gcad pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zag de yang skad cig ma'am /
analyzed: dngos po la gcig rnam par gcad pa dang / yongs su gcod pa dag ni de las gzhan yongs su gcod pa dang / rnam par gcad pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gang zag de yang skad cig ma'am /
translated: For, in regard to an entity, the exclusion of one thing and the determination of another are invariably related.üîΩAnd that person would be momentary,

original: skad cig ma ma yin par 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin par 'gyur grang na //
translated: or not momentary.

original: re zhig gal te skad cig ma ma yin pa de'i tshe skad cig ma las phyi ma'i gnas skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gal te skad cig ma ma yin pa de'i tshe skad cig ma las phyi ma'i gnas skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir rtag pa yin no //
translated: If he is not momentary, then he is permanent, because he is not different from the state that existed previously.

original: de bas na rtag pa ni rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'gal lo //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa ni rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to say that a permanent thing is not to be described as permanent.

original: mi rtag pa ste skad cig ma nyid du brjod bya min gang yin de ni med pa nyid yin no //üîΩde 'ga' zhig gi ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ste skad cig ma nyid du brjod bya min gang yin de ni med pa nyid yin no // de 'ga' zhig gi ste /
translated: And that which is not to be described as impermanent, as momentary, is nonexistent.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: That is, it is not the cause of any effect.üîΩThis has been explained.

original: de bas na gang zag yod pa nyid ma yin pa des na 'di la sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid can gyi 'ching ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag yod pa nyid ma yin pa des na 'di la sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid can gyi 'ching ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the person does not exist, there is no bondage that has the characteristic of being the cause of the arising of suffering.

original: de'i tshe ma bcings ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma bcings ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: At that time, that which is not bound is not liberation, which has the characteristic of not being the cause of suffering.üîΩThus, how could there be

original: rnam pa ji ltar bcings thar pa //
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar bcings thar pa //
translated: Bondage and liberation?

original: brjod bya min la'ang mi rung ngo //üîΩgal te rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i @87a * //
analyzed: brjod bya min la'ang mi rung ngo // gal te rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i @87a * //
translated: They are not even tenable as inexpressible.

original: phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThere is no error because they are not even tenable as permanent,‚Äù

original: de ltar brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa ni bla ste /üîΩde ltar na yang re zhig de'i rang bzhin dus thams cad na yod pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa ni bla ste / de ltar na yang re zhig de'i rang bzhin dus thams cad na yod pa'am /
translated: then it is better that they are not even tenable as expressible.

original: yod pa ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: However, in that case, you must say that their nature exists at all times or that it does not exist.

original: de bas na gal te yod pa yin pa de'i tshe rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gal te yod pa yin pa de'i tshe rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if it exists, it is permanent.

original: de ltar na rtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, there is no such thing as what is called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod do //
translated: Thus, the wise say that the nature of that which is not subject to destruction is permanent.

original: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa med pa'i ngo bo can gyi gang zag tu sgro btags pa'i /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa med pa'i ngo bo can gyi gang zag tu sgro btags pa'i /
translated: When it is like that, then this view of the person, which is the superimposition of the nature of the permanent and the impermanent,

original: lta 'di ngo tsha med spangs pa //
analyzed: lta 'di ngo tsha med spangs pa //
translated: is the abandonment of shamelessness.

original: mkhas pa'i tshogs la ngo tsha bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tshogs la ngo tsha bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is shameful to the assembly of the wise.

original: rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa de phyir drang po'i rnam pas gang zag de ni rtag ces brjod /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa de phyir drang po'i rnam pas gang zag de ni rtag ces brjod /
translated: Because of the non-destruction of its nature, the person is said to be permanent in the manner of being straight.

original: phyis pa'i rtsed mo'i rtog pa dang 'dra bar lung du ma bstan pa'i tshig la dmigs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: phyis pa'i rtsed mo'i rtog pa dang 'dra bar lung du ma bstan pa'i tshig la dmigs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of observing neutral words, like the thought of a child's play?

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad zin to //
translated: The truth of cessation has been explained.

original: da lam gyi bden pa'i skabs su bab pas bshad zin lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: da lam gyi bden pa'i skabs su bab pas bshad zin lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: Now, since the occasion is the truth of the path, it is explained with What is called the path... and so on.

original: ston pa'i tshig bshad pa'i skabs su ji ltar bdag med pa nyid mthong ba goms pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di ni thabs goms pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas bshad zin to //
analyzed: ston pa'i tshig bshad pa'i skabs su ji ltar bdag med pa nyid mthong ba goms pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di ni thabs goms pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas bshad zin to //
translated: The Teacher has already explained this in the passage: ‚ÄúThe cultivation of the path is the repeated practice of the vision of selflessness.‚Äù

original: lam de goms pa las bdag med pa mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam de'i sgom pa rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: lam de goms pa las bdag med pa mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam de'i sgom pa rdzogs pa na /
translated: From the repeated practice of that path, the cultivation of that path, which is characterized by the vision of selflessness, is completed.

original: rten ni yongs su gyur par 'gyur //
analyzed: rten ni yongs su gyur par 'gyur //
translated: Then the basis is transformed.

original: nyes pa dang bcas pa'i sems shin tu skye ba med pa'i chos can yod na /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas pa'i sems shin tu skye ba med pa'i chos can yod na /
translated: If the mind that is subject to error were not to arise,

original: lam de'i bdag nyid la sems gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam de'i bdag nyid la sems gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the mind would abide in the nature of that path. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te goms kyang lam bzhin du //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te goms kyang lam bzhin du //
translated: This is so, butüîΩif it were to arise from cultivation,

original: nyes 'byung ji ltar nyes pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i sems lam gyi rnam par 'byung ba de bzhin du lam goms pa la gnas pa'i yang nyes par 'byung ba'i phyir grol ba nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: nyes 'byung ji ltar nyes pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i sems lam gyi rnam par 'byung ba de bzhin du lam goms pa la gnas pa'i yang nyes par 'byung ba'i phyir grol ba nyid med do zhe na /
translated: just as the path arises from the nature of error, then, since error would arise, there would be no liberation.

original: skyon de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nus med phyir /
analyzed: nus med phyir /
translated: Because it is powerless.

original: lam goms pa la gnas pa'i sems la nyes pa rnams yang 'byung ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lam goms pa la gnas pa'i sems la nyes pa rnams yang 'byung ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind that is established in the cultivation of the path does not have the power to produce faults.

original: de ltar na sems kyi rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid can yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na sems kyi rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid can yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the nature of the mind is the identity of seeing reality.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i nyes pa de'i @87b bdag nyid can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i nyes pa de'i @87b bdag nyid can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the identity of faults that are connected with the aspect of error.

original: 'di'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de yang glo bur ba'i rkyen gyi dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de yang glo bur ba'i rkyen gyi dbang gis yin no //
translated: And whatever secondary mental afflictions it has are due to the power of adventitious conditions.

original: de la gnod pa yod na rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i sems ni yang nyes pa'i rten byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gnod pa yod na rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i sems ni yang nyes pa'i rten byed pa ma yin te /
translated: When those are removed, the mind that is established in its own nature does not again serve as a basis for faults,

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is by nature engaged through the power of things.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa rkyen gyi dbang gis rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa de ni rkyen dang shin tu bral bar yod na rang gi de'i bdag nyid thob pa yang bdag nyid de'i rten du 'gyurüîΩba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa rkyen gyi dbang gis rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa de ni rkyen dang shin tu bral bar yod na rang gi de'i bdag nyid thob pa yang bdag nyid de'i rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The preparation is that which is naturally of that nature, but due to the power of conditions, it appears in another aspect. If it is completely devoid of conditions, it does not obtain its own nature, nor does it become the basis of that nature.

original: dper na gser rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa 'dres pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis 'dres par gyur pa rnam par sbyangs pas de shin tu med pa na rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa yang bdag nyid ma dag par grol ba ma yin pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na gser rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa 'dres pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis 'dres par gyur pa rnam par sbyangs pas de shin tu med pa na rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa yang bdag nyid ma dag par grol ba ma yin pa lta bu'am /
translated: For example, it is like gold, which is naturally pure, but due to the power of conditions it becomes mixed, and through purification it becomes completely devoid of that. Then, even though it abides in its own nature, it is not liberated from its impure nature.

original: 'di lta ste sems de nyid rang bzhin gyis thag pa la thag pa'i rnam par mthong ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis sbrul du snang ba /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems de nyid rang bzhin gyis thag pa la thag pa'i rnam par mthong ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis sbrul du snang ba /
translated: Or, it is like the mind itself, which is naturally of the nature of seeing a rope as a rope, but due to the power of conditions it appears as a snake.

original: de'i rkyen shin tu med pa na yang sbrul du 'dzin pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen shin tu med pa na yang sbrul du 'dzin pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Even when those conditions are completely absent, it is not grasped as a snake.

original: sems kyang rang bzhin nyid kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i bdag nyid can gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyang rang bzhin nyid kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i bdag nyid can gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the mind, by the power of conditions, is engaged in other aspects, having the nature of seeing suchness, the nature itself. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i chos kyang gang zhe na zhes dris pa na don dam par rnam par shes pa ni don 'dzin par 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i chos kyang gang zhe na zhes dris pa na don dam par rnam par shes pa ni don 'dzin par 'dod pas /
translated: Thus, when asked ‚ÄúWhat is the dharma of consciousness?‚Äù it is asserted that ultimately consciousness apprehends objects.

original: rnam shes yul 'dzin pa'i chos zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam shes yul 'dzin pa'i chos zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that consciousness is the dharma that apprehends objects.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa yul can du gyur pa thams cad kyi chos yul 'dzin pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa yul can du gyur pa thams cad kyi chos yul 'dzin pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When all consciousnesses that are subjects apprehend objects,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis /
translated: by means of aspects such as impermanence,

original: ji ltar de ni yod pa bzhin /
analyzed: ji ltar de ni yod pa bzhin /
translated: they apprehend objects as they exist.

original: yul yod pa de bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur gyi med pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul yod pa de bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur gyi med pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not apprehend them by means of nonexistent aspects.

original: de de ltar na shes pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yul du byed par rigs pas thob pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar na shes pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yul du byed par rigs pas thob pa na /
translated: Thus, when it is reasonable to obtain an object just as it is,

original: de ltar na rtogs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol lam cig shos glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rtogs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol lam cig shos glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin te /
translated: then that which is not realized is due to the external or some other cause of adventitious error.

original: dper na sbrul du 'dris pa'i phyogs mi gsal bar thag pa la sbrul gyi shes pa lta bu'o //üîΩde bas na yul gyi rnam pa yong ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni sems @88a * //
analyzed: dper na sbrul du 'dris pa'i phyogs mi gsal bar thag pa la sbrul gyi shes pa lta bu'o // de bas na yul gyi rnam pa yong ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni sems @88a * //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of a snake on a rope in an unclear place where one is familiar with snakes.

original: kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, that which apprehends the appearance of an object is the nature of the mind.

original: ci ste yang log par 'dzin pa nyid rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe yul 'dzin pa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang log par 'dzin pa nyid rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe yul 'dzin pa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: If, however, the very apprehension of the unreal is the nature, then it is not the quality of apprehending an object.

original: de ltar na ji ltar shes pas yul du byed pa de ltar don de ma yin zhing ji ltar don de yin pa de ltar yul du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar shes pas yul du byed pa de ltar don de ma yin zhing ji ltar don de yin pa de ltar yul du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, just as the object is made into an object by consciousness, it is not that object. Just as it is that object, it is not made into an object.

original: shes pa dag yul med pa can du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: shes pa dag yul med pa can du 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, consciousnesses would be without objects.

original: gang gang gi yul lam yul can nyid yin /
analyzed: gang gang gi yul lam yul can nyid yin /
translated: What is the object or subject?

original: de ltar na dngos po thams cad ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po thams cad ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all things are not established,

original: shes pa yang phyin ci log gi rnam pa la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa yang phyin ci log gi rnam pa la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness also observes the aspect of error.

original: de ni yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: de ni yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyi skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context of the establishment of the relationship between object and subject.

original: de bas na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po 'dod pa nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i chos yul 'dzin pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po 'dod pa nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i chos yul 'dzin pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by merely asserting the relationship between object and subject, it must be said that the phenomenon of consciousness is the apprehension of an object.

original: de ltar na 'di'i rang bzhin ni yang dag pa'i yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di'i rang bzhin ni yang dag pa'i yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, its nature is the apprehension of the aspect of a real object.

original: de rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni glo bur gyi rkyen gyis byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni glo bur gyi rkyen gyis byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever transformation it undergoes is due to adventitious conditions.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang rnam pa yod pa ma yin pa de ni de la de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes pas ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang rnam pa yod pa ma yin pa de ni de la de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes pas ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not exist in a certain way is not apprehended as that by a consciousness that apprehends its nature.

original: dper na bde ba la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa med pa bde ba rig pa'i shes pas shes pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa med pa bde ba rig pa'i shes pas shes pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the case of pleasure, the aspect of pain does not exist, and the cognition that cognizes pleasure does not cognize it.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the five appropriated aggregates do not have the aspects of permanence, pleasure, purity, and self. This is the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: gang zhig gang la rnam pa med par 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa yin pa de ni de la glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rnam pa med par 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa yin pa de ni de la glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that apprehends something as lacking an aspect is mistaken due to the adventitious signs of error.

original: dper na thag pa la sbrul gyi shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sbrul gyi shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the cognition of a snake in a rope.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i shes pa yang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i shes pa yang /
translated: The cognition that apprehends the five appropriated aggregates as having the aspects of permanence, etc.

original: rnam pa med pa 'dzin pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa 'dzin pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: is the apprehension of what lacks an aspect. This is a natural inference.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i rang bzhin de las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i rang bzhin de las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can yin te /
translated: That which has a certain nature cannot be transformed into something else by adventitious conditions.

original: dper na thag par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes pa'i glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i rang bzhin las rnam par gzhan du 'gyur ba can yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thag par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes pa'i glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i rang bzhin las rnam par gzhan du 'gyur ba can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the nature of the consciousness that apprehends a rope cannot be transformed by adventitious conditions into something else.

original: de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa yang yang dag pa'i @88b yul gyi rnam par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa yang yang dag pa'i @88b yul gyi rnam par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the consciousness that has that as its object is by nature the apprehender of the aspect of the real object. This is a logical argument from nature.

original: yang na gang zhig gang la rnam pa med pa de ni de la glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i 'khrul ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khyad par gyi sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig gang la rnam pa med pa de ni de la glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i 'khrul ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khyad par gyi sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: Or, that which does not have a certain aspect is superimposed by a special erroneous consciousness produced by adventitious conditions.

original: dper na thag pa la sprul gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sprul gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the aspect of a snake on a rope.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang rtag pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang rtag pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates also do not have the aspect of permanence. This is a natural inference.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sngar bkag pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sngar bkag pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the nature of permanence, etc. has already been refuted.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad la ma grub pa'i dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad la ma grub pa'i dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no need for any inference to be unestablished.

original: yod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It has the nature of existence.

original: de'i skyed par byed pa'ang yin //
analyzed: de'i skyed par byed pa'ang yin //
translated: It is also the producer of that.

original: yul de ni yul can gyi rnam par shes pa de'i skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: yul de ni yul can gyi rnam par shes pa de'i skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: That object is asserted to be the producer of the consciousness that has it as its object.

original: skyed par byed pa yod pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni skyed par byed par rigs pa yin pa de'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yod pa'i yul gang yin pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yod pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni skyed par byed par rigs pa yin pa de'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yod pa'i yul gang yin pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed
translated: That which has the nature of being a producer is reasonable as a producer. Therefore, the aspect that exists as impermanent, etc. is the very aspect of the object that produces its own consciousness.

original: pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni yul gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni yul gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the object.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi skyed par byed par yin pa de ni ji ltar bdag nyid yod pa de ltar de skyed par byed par 'gyur te dper na sa bon la sogs pa ji ltar bdag nyid yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi skyed par byed par yin pa de ni ji ltar bdag nyid yod pa de ltar de skyed par byed par 'gyur te dper na sa bon la sogs pa ji ltar bdag nyid yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Here, the syllogism is: Whatever is a producer of something is a producer of that just as it exists, for example, a seed, etc.üîΩ

original: myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the syllogism is: Whatever is the producer of something, it produces that in the same way that it exists, as for example, a seed, etc. produces a sprout, etc. in the same way that it exists.

original: yul yang rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yul yang rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And an object produces a consciousness that apprehends its own nature. This is a reason of nature.

original: gang dag de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de dag ni rang bzhin des rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de dag ni rang bzhin des rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever does not have that nature does not produce its own effect by means of that nature.

original: dper na s'a lu la sogs pa nas kyi sa bon ma yin pa dag ni nas kyi sa bon gyi bdag nyid can gyi rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu la sogs pa nas kyi sa bon ma yin pa dag ni nas kyi sa bon gyi bdag nyid can gyi rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, rice, etc. does not produce the effect that has the nature of a barley seed.

original: yul yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yul yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: 'di yang ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not unestablished,

original: sngar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because impermanence, etc. have already been established earlier.

original: de de ltar na 'di ltar rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rang 'dzin pa'i shes pa skyed par @89a * //
analyzed: de de ltar na 'di ltar rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rang 'dzin pa'i shes pa skyed par @89a * //
translated: Thus, the nature of the object is that which generates the cognition apprehending it just as it is.

original: byed pa de ni yul gyi rang bzhin yin la yul can gyi yang yang dag pa'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: byed pa de ni yul gyi rang bzhin yin la yul can gyi yang yang dag pa'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The nature of the subject is the correct conceptualization of the object.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang gi rang bzhin 'di las ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang gi rang bzhin 'di las ni /
translated: From this nature as explained,

original: rgyu gzhan gyis ni glo bur ba'i 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rang gi yul la sems /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyis ni glo bur ba'i 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rang gi yul la sems /
translated: the mind with regard to its object is turned away from other causes, i.e., the causes of adventitious error.

original: de gzhan 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gzhan 'gyur te /
translated: It is turned away from other objects,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa ni gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa ni gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: i.e., it is turned away from engaging in superimposition in the aspect of permanence, etc.

original: gzhan du gyur pa de las ldog pa la ni rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rkyen la ltas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa de las ldog pa la ni rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rkyen la ltas pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is a transformation of other, which is dependent on a condition that is a cause of reversal, a cause of transformation into another state.

original: de ltar skyes bu'i 'khrul pa gnod pa can gyi tshad ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu'i 'khrul pa gnod pa can gyi tshad ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the error of a person is dependent on a valid cognition that is erroneous.

original: mi brtan pa ste glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa'i rkyen gyis rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can du byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po ma yin pa'i stobs kyis zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gnod pa can gyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi brtan pa ste glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa'i rkyen gyis rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can du byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po ma yin pa'i stobs kyis zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gnod pa can gyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is made to be a transformation into another state by the condition of an unstable, adventitious error, because it is engaged by the power of a nonentity, and because a valid cognition that is erroneous is possible.

original: yul la 'di rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul la 'di rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is that it is a cognition of an object in a different aspect.

original: rang bzhin nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the nature itself.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: thag pa la sprul gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sprul gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of a snake in a rope.

original: de thams cad kyis gang zhig rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs grub par nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad kyis gang zhig rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs grub par nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
translated: All of these are the application of the proof of the syllogism, ‚ÄúWhatever is essentially luminous is essentially free from defilement, like the mind.

original: de'i phyir sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of this mind is luminous.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the mind to apprehend things as they are.

original: dri ma rnams ni bdag tu lta ba dang chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni bdag tu lta ba dang chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Defilements are such things as the view of the transitory collection and attachment.

original: rkyen gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan las 'ongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan las 'ongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are adventitious, because they come from other conditions.

original: glo bur ba yin gyi de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur ba yin gyi de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the nature of the mind.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni rang dang ris mthun pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis 'jug pa yin gyi de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni rang dang ris mthun pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis 'jug pa yin gyi de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the nature of the mind, but rather they arise through the power of the causes that appropriate the aggregates of the same type.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba'i mngon sum du byas pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba'i mngon sum du byas pa'i rgyu /
translated: The cause of the direct perception of the view of selflessness is

original: de'i phyir sngar nus med pa yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar nus med pa yang /
translated: Therefore, even though it was previously powerless,

original: dri ma rnams kyi sems la sngar yang gnod pa byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dri ma rnams kyi sems la sngar yang gnod pa byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The defilements are not able to harm the mind previously,

original: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas dngos po med pa'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma'i grogs med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas dngos po med pa'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma'i grogs med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged by the power of the non-existence of the thing through the aspect of superimposition, and because they are devoid of the support of valid knowledge.

original: yang gang las phyis te /
analyzed: yang gang las phyis te /
translated: Moreover, from what?

original: bdag med pa mthong ba @89b goms pa grub pa na de'i rang bzhin lam de'i bdag nyid can gyi sems la nus pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba @89b goms pa grub pa na de'i rang bzhin lam de'i bdag nyid can gyi sems la nus pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: When the familiarization with the view of selflessness is accomplished, the mind that has the nature of that path is devoid of the power to do that. This is the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar sems ni ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid can yin la dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba ma yin pa de ni nyid kyis phyir nyes pa'i tshogs skyed pa'i nus pa yod na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar sems ni ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid can yin la dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba ma yin pa de ni nyid kyis phyir nyes pa'i tshogs skyed pa'i nus pa yod na yang /
translated: Because the mind is by nature the essence of seeing reality in that way, and the defilements are not adventitious, even if they have the power to generate a mass of faults,

original: shin tu skyed nus med yin no //
analyzed: shin tu skyed nus med yin no //
translated: they are utterly incapable of doing so.

original: gang gis sems kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i bdag nyid can bsal nas gang la skyed par mi nus pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis sems kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i bdag nyid can bsal nas gang la skyed par mi nus pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If one sees the reality of mind, then having eliminated the essence of that, how can it be incapable of generating?

original: sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'i dngos po la'o //
translated: It is in regard to the entity called the continuum of mind.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gnod pa can skyed nus snying po can te bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam 'khrul pa la gnod pa can skyed pa de'i nus pa de nyid snying po ste mchog gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can skyed nus snying po can te bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam 'khrul pa la gnod pa can skyed pa de'i nus pa de nyid snying po ste mchog gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: It has the essence of being capable of generating the antidote, that is, the path characterized by the vision of selflessness, which is the antidote to error. That very capacity is its essence, its supreme.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sa rlon la ni me bzhin no //
analyzed: sa rlon la ni me bzhin no //
translated: Like fire in wet wood.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩji ltar rtag tu chus bangs ba'i rang bzhin gyis la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / ji ltar rtag tu chus bangs ba'i rang bzhin gyis la /
translated: It is like this.üîΩJust as fire, which is the essence of heat, is not very much in flames in wet wood, whose nature is always soaked with water,

original: shing stobs dang ldan pa can me ches shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shing stobs dang ldan pa can me ches shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so it is.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la gnod pa can skyed nus pa'i /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la gnod pa can skyed nus pa'i /
translated: The application is this: If something is capable of generating an antidote to something,

original: snying po can yin pa de ni de la shin tu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: snying po can yin pa de ni de la shin tu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The essence of the continuum of consciousness is not at all born in that way.

original: dper na sa rlon pa la mi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa rlon pa la mi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a man on dry land.üîΩThe continuum of consciousness has an essence that is able to generate the vision of reality that is harmful to the afflictions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyang nyon mongs pa la gnod pa can de kho na nyid mthong ba skyed nus pa'i snying po can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyang nyon mongs pa la gnod pa can de kho na nyid mthong ba skyed nus pa'i snying po can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it unestablished.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du gnod pa can gyi rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du gnod pa can gyi rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason for the harm is accepted just as the conditions of direct perception and inference are.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the case, but

original: ji ltar nyes pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la gnas pa de la gnod pa can gyi lam skye ba de ltar lam de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i skyes bu la yang ci'i phyir nyes pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyes pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la gnas pa de la gnod pa can gyi lam skye ba de ltar lam de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i skyes bu la yang ci'i phyir nyes pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: just as the harm is generated in the person who has become the nature of that fault, in the same way, why would the fault not be generated in the person who has become the nature of that path?

original: 'gal ba ni gnyig la yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni gnyig la yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the contradiction exists in both.

original: 'dir ji ltar ngo bo nyid kyis lam gyi rang bzhin can gyi sems 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis sbrul gyi blo bzhin du rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa goms pa'i dbang gis 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan shin tu gsal ba na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar ngo bo nyid kyis lam gyi rang bzhin can gyi sems 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis sbrul gyi blo bzhin du rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa goms pa'i dbang gis 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan shin tu gsal ba na /
translated: Here, it has been explained that just as the nature of the mind, which is the nature of the path, does not change into another aspect due to the cause of error, like the idea of a snake,

original: nyes pa rnams kyi skabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad @90a * //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi skabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad @90a * //
translated: when the cause of error is very clear due to the power of habituation, there is no opportunity for faults.

original: zin to // gzhan yang rang bzhin 'bad rtsol med par zlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zin to // gzhan yang rang bzhin 'bad rtsol med par zlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to reverse the nature without effort.

original: rang bzhin yang lhag mthong yin la 'bad rtsol yang nyes pa mthong ba'i sgo nas byed par gyur na /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang lhag mthong yin la 'bad rtsol yang nyes pa mthong ba'i sgo nas byed par gyur na /
translated: If the nature is insight and effort is made through seeing faults,

original: de yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that also does not exist here.

original: lhag mthong ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa rnams ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir bskyed pa la 'bad rtsol yod pa ma yin no //üîΩblo ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa rnams ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir bskyed pa la 'bad rtsol yod pa ma yin no // blo ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: Because insight is a quality and faults are mistaken, there is no effort in producing them.üîΩThe mind, even though it strives

original: nyes pa skyed pa'i phyir brtson dang ldan yang /
analyzed: nyes pa skyed pa'i phyir brtson dang ldan yang /
translated: to produce faults in some way,

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //üîΩnyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa yon tan dang ldan pa'i lam gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro // nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa yon tan dang ldan pa'i lam gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: because the mind is oriented toward that.

original: nyes pa rnams kyis lam la gnod med do //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyis lam la gnod med do //
translated: The path is not harmed by faults, because it is the cause for the orientation of the mind toward the side of virtue, which is the antidote to faults.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /üîΩ'tshe ba med dang yang dag don /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na / 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don /
translated: What is the path like?

original: rang bzhin la ni phyin ci log gis /
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni phyin ci log gis /
translated: The path is nonviolent and has the nature of reality.

original: lam ni 'tshe ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: lam ni 'tshe ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The path has the nature of nonviolence,

original: rnam par 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang bde ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang bde ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by the pacification of all violence and by happiness.

original: yang dag pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: It has the nature of reality,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has as its object the impermanence, etc. of the aggregates.

original: des ni tshad ma'i grogs can nyid yin par bshad do //
analyzed: des ni tshad ma'i grogs can nyid yin par bshad do //
translated: This explains that the path has valid knowledge as its companion.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin las phyin ci log pa'i nyes pa nyes dmigs dang bcas pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i grogs can de dag gis gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin las phyin ci log pa'i nyes pa nyes dmigs dang bcas pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i grogs can de dag gis gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The faults and disadvantages of the opposite of the nature as it has been explained cannot harm those who have the companion of valid knowledge.

original: lhag ma ni gong du bshad pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gong du bshad pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as it has been explained above.

original: bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa bdag med pa nyid mthong ba bshad zin lam de goms pa las /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa bdag med pa nyid mthong ba bshad zin lam de goms pa las /
translated: The antidote to attachment to self and so forth is the seeing of selflessness. It has been explained that through cultivating that path,

original: rten ni yongs su gyur par 'gyur zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la nges pa 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten ni yongs su gyur par 'gyur zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la nges pa 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äúthe basis will be completely transformed.‚Äù But there is no certainty in this.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phan tshun 'gal ba yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phan tshun 'gal ba yin du zin kyang /
translated: This is because, although attachment and anger are mutually exclusive,

original: gcig shin tu goms pa las gzhan shin tu nyams pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig shin tu goms pa las gzhan shin tu nyams pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not the case that one is completely destroyed by the cultivation of the other.

original: de ni / 'dod chags khong khro phan tshun dag / mtshan nyid tha dad na yang gnod pa med /
analyzed: de ni / 'dod chags khong khro phan tshun dag / mtshan nyid tha dad na yang gnod pa med /
translated: Although attachment and anger have different characteristics, there is no contradiction.

original: gang gis ni de dag shin tu 'gal ba yin ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ni de dag shin tu 'gal ba yin ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: By what are they mutually exclusive? Why?

original: bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig nyid dang ste /
analyzed: bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig nyid dang ste /
translated: Because they have the same cause,

original: 'dod chags dang zhes dang dag rgyu gcig pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhes dang dag rgyu gcig pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, because they have the same cause as the view of self.

original: rgyu gcig ni bdag tu lta ba @90b yin la /
analyzed: rgyu gcig ni bdag tu lta ba @90b yin la /
translated: The same cause is the view of self.

original: rgyu gcig nyid kyis de dag gi nang nas ji ltar rgyu de yod na gcig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nyid kyis de dag gi nang nas ji ltar rgyu de yod na gcig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: By the same cause, just as one of them arises when that cause exists,

original: rgyu des de skyed pa na gdon mi za bar thag nye bas 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des de skyed pa na gdon mi za bar thag nye bas 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: so when that cause generates it, then it necessarily becomes proximate.

original: de nyid las kyang rkyen ji lta bzhin du gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba yin pa de ltar na ji ltar 'gal ba yin /
analyzed: de nyid las kyang rkyen ji lta bzhin du gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba yin pa de ltar na ji ltar 'gal ba yin /
translated: And from that, others arise in accordance with conditions. So how is there a contradiction?

original: cig car mi 'jug pa yang nye bar len pa'i sems kyis rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis 'phen par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car mi 'jug pa yang nye bar len pa'i sems kyis rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis 'phen par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not simultaneous because the appropriating mind cannot project two minds of the same type.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no gang la bdag tu chags pa de nyid la yang de la gnod pa byed pa la zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no gang la bdag tu chags pa de nyid la yang de la gnod pa byed pa la zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: And when there is attachment to something, there is also aversion to anything that harms it.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gi rgyu yin te gang zhig gang gi rgyu mtshan yin pa de ni de dang 'gal ba ma yin no //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig rgyu gcig pa can yin pa de ni de dang lhan cig gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gi rgyu yin te gang zhig gang gi rgyu mtshan yin pa de ni de dang 'gal ba ma yin no // sbyor ba ni gang zhig rgyu gcig pa can yin pa de ni de dang lhan cig gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Thus, attachment is the cause of aversion, and that which is the cause of something is not its contradictory.

original: shing gi khyad par gcig las 'byung ba can gyi me dang du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing gi khyad par gcig las 'byung ba can gyi me dang du ba lta bu'o //
translated: And when there is a single cause, there is no contradiction between the two, as in the case of fire and smoke, which have a single cause, the burning of fuel.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang yang rgyu gcig pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang yang rgyu gcig pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And attachment and aversion have a single cause, which is a conceptual thought that conceives of something as desirable or undesirable.üîΩThis is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bor gyur pa de dag ni shin tu goms pa'i dbang gis phan tshun gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bor gyur pa de dag ni shin tu goms pa'i dbang gis phan tshun gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: And those that are essentially cause and effect are not contradictory, because they are mutually dependent, like the prior and subsequent moments of a flame.üîΩAnd those that are essentially cause and effect are not contradictory, because they are mutually dependent, like the prior and subsequent moments of a flame.

original: dper na bdag tu lta ba dang bdag tu chags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag tu lta ba dang bdag tu chags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the view of self and attachment to self.üîΩAttachment to the perishable constituents and hatred are also causes and results.

original: 'jig tshogs la chags pa dang / zhe sdang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la chags pa dang / zhe sdang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: byams pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin na ci'i phyir nyes pa shin tu rgyun gcod par mi 'dod ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin na ci'i phyir nyes pa shin tu rgyun gcod par mi 'dod ce na bshad pa /
translated: If loving-kindness and impurity, etc., are antidotes to hatred, etc., why is it not accepted that they completely eradicate the faults?

original: byams sogs rmongs dang 'gal med phyir //
analyzed: byams sogs rmongs dang 'gal med phyir //
translated: Loving-kindness, etc., are not antidotes to delusion.

original: gti mug gnyes pa rnams kyi rgyu dang sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug gnyes pa rnams kyi rgyu dang sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Loving-kindness, etc., which have sentient beings as their object, are not antidotes to the faults of delusion.

original: de bas na byams pa la sogs pas nyes pa shin tu tshad gcod med /
analyzed: de bas na byams pa la sogs pas nyes pa shin tu tshad gcod med /
translated: Therefore, loving-kindness, etc., do not completely eradicate the faults.

original: 'on kyang ji srid rigs mi mthun pa'i sems goms pa gnas pa'i dus de srid du kun nas ldang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji srid rigs mi mthun pa'i sems goms pa gnas pa'i dus de srid du kun nas ldang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, as long as the mind that is not of the same type as loving-kindness, etc., is cultivated, the faults will arise.

original: nyes kun de yi rtsa ba can //
analyzed: nyes kun de yi rtsa ba can //
translated: All faults have that as their root.

original: gti mug de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin /
analyzed: gti mug de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin /
translated: And that delusion is the view of the transitory composite.

original: de ltar na @91a * //
analyzed: de ltar na @91a * //
translated: Thus,

original: nyes ba rnams kyi rgyu la gnod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes ba rnams kyi rgyu la gnod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no harm to the cause of faults,

original: nyes pa rnams shin tu rtsa ba nas 'don pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams shin tu rtsa ba nas 'don pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because faults are not completely uprooted,

original: byams pa la sogs pa rab tu brtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa rab tu brtag pa ma yin no //
translated: love, etc. are not well-ascertained.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod pa med ba de ni de la shin tu gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod pa med ba de ni de la shin tu gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not harmful to the cause of something is not harmful to that thing,

original: dper na mdar zhing snum la bsil ba'i rdzas rnams bad kan gyi nad kyi rgyu la gnod pa med pa de nad la gnod pa med pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mdar zhing snum la bsil ba'i rdzas rnams bad kan gyi nad kyi rgyu la gnod pa med pa de nad la gnod pa med pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the substances that are sweet, oily, and cool are not harmful to the disease of phlegm.

original: sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa'ang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs su lta ba la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa'ang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs su lta ba la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And love, etc. that have sentient beings as their object do not harm the view of the transitory composite, which is the cause of the arising of the afflictions. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dag gi sman til mar la sogs pa'i chos mthun pa nyid can gyi zhe sdang la sogs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa gnyen por bshad pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dag gi sman til mar la sogs pa'i chos mthun pa nyid can gyi zhe sdang la sogs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa gnyen por bshad pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: The antidotes of anger and so on are explained to be love and so on, which have the same qualities as the medicines for wind, bile, and phlegm, such as sesame oil.

original: dus de srid du mngon sum du rgyu ba la gnod pa nyid kyis gnyen po yin pa dgongs pas bshad pa'am /
analyzed: dus de srid du mngon sum du rgyu ba la gnod pa nyid kyis gnyen po yin pa dgongs pas bshad pa'am /
translated: But this is explained by the intention that they are antidotes because they directly harm those that are to be abandoned for that length of time.

original: chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Or they are love and so on that focus on phenomena. Thus there is no contradiction and no error.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the same is so for others as appropriate.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni don phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i ngo bo can yin zhing /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni don phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i ngo bo can yin zhing /
translated: Some of our schools think: The view of the transitory collection has the nature of conceiving the meaning of the self in a distorted way.

original: mi shes pa mi gsal pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan nyid yin na de ji ltar na gti mug de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin zhes tha snyad du bya bar rigs zhes rang gi sde pa 'ga' zhig sems te /
analyzed: mi shes pa mi gsal pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan nyid yin na de ji ltar na gti mug de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin zhes tha snyad du bya bar rigs zhes rang gi sde pa 'ga' zhig sems te /
translated: But ignorance has the nature of unclear noncomprehension. How can it be tenable to call that ignorance the view of the transitory collection?

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'jog pa dpyod pa de dag gis kyang don phyin ci log brtogs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'jog pa dpyod pa de dag gis kyang don phyin ci log brtogs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who analyze the definition of ignorance should accept that it is the nature of the understanding of a false object.

original: de la gti mug spyi ni log pa'i shes pa thams cad yin la /
analyzed: de la gti mug spyi ni log pa'i shes pa thams cad yin la /
translated: Here, the general ignorance is all wrong consciousnesses.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin te /
translated: Its specific characteristic is the view of the transitory composite,

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin pa de ltar na de gti mug gang zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin pa de ltar na de gti mug gang zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the afflictions. Thus, it is explained that ignorance is the most important of the afflictions.

original: de la re zhig yang dag pa'i don mthong ba ni rig pa yin la /üîΩma rig pa zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa de las gzhan pa'am /üîΩde dang 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: de la re zhig yang dag pa'i don mthong ba ni rig pa yin la / ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa de las gzhan pa'am / de dang 'gal ba'am /
translated: Here, first, seeing the meaning of reality is knowledge.

original: de med pa'i chos yin grang na /
analyzed: de med pa'i chos yin grang na /
translated: Is the understanding called ignorance different from that, or is it contrary to it, or is it a phenomenon that is its absence?

original: re zhig gzhan ni ma yin @91b te /
analyzed: re zhig gzhan ni ma yin @91b te /
translated: First, it is not different,

original: gzugs la sogs ba yang de lta bur thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ba yang de lta bur thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that form and so on would be ignorance.

original: med pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it its absence,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the state of the characteristic of a thing.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it is a counteragent,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid kyang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid kyang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: then a counteragent has a contradictory nature.

original: de ltar na rnam pa gang rig pas gzung ba de las phyin ci log pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa can ni ma rig pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gang rig pas gzung ba de las phyin ci log pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa can ni ma rig pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that which is grasped by a certain mode of apprehension is called ignorance if it grasps a mode of apprehension that is the opposite of that.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi de ni mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi de ni mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is so, but that is not the characteristic of ignorance.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: yang dag par rtogs pas dper na pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pas dper na pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: It is said that ignorance has the characteristic of being covered, like a pot.

original: yang dag pa'i don mthong bas dben pa ni med pa tsam yin na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don mthong bas dben pa ni med pa tsam yin na /
translated: If the absence of seeing the true meaning is mere nonexistence,üîΩhow can it be the characteristic of ignorance, which has the nature of an entity?

original: ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo can gyi ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rig pa ma yin pas dngos po la reg pa yin na yang //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo can gyi ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rig pa ma yin pas dngos po la reg pa yin na yang //
translated: Even though it touches an entity,

original: sems med pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems med pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: it would follow that it would also exist in the mindless.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa pos ma rig pa'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba khyad par gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ma 'chol bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa pos ma rig pa'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba khyad par gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ma 'chol bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the theorist should state the unmixed definition of ignorance, saying, ‚ÄúThe nature of ignorance is this.‚Äù

original: gang yod na don gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i gags byed par 'gyur ba de ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mtshan nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang de ni 'bras bu dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yod na don gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i gags byed par 'gyur ba de ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mtshan nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang de ni 'bras bu dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Also, the statement, ‚ÄúThat which, when it exists, acts as an obstruction to seeing the reality of an object, is ignorance,‚Äù is not a definition, but rather a statement of the result of ignorance.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, its definition should be stated in another way.

original: de yang dpyad par bya na /üîΩrig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid phyir //üîΩlog par dmigs pa'i mi shes pa ni ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dpyad par bya na / rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid phyir // log par dmigs pa'i mi shes pa ni ma rig pa yin no //
translated: And that should be analyzed.üîΩBecause it is the antithesis of knowledge,üîΩignorance is the non-understanding that wrongly grasps.

original: rig pas gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pas gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The nature of ignorance is the opposite of the form in which knowledge grasps.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang rtog pa dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin can de ni des gzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang rtog pa dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin can de ni des gzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúThat which is of a nature contradictory to the conception of something is of a nature that is the opposite of the aspect apprehended by it.

original: dper na bde ba'i 'du shes kyis gzung ba'i rnam pa las 'dus byas rnam la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes ni phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba'i 'du shes kyis gzung ba'i rnam pa las 'dus byas rnam la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes ni phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the conception of suffering is of a nature that is the opposite of the aspect apprehended by the conception of pleasure.üîΩIgnorance is of a nature contradictory to the conception of knowledge.

original: ma rig pa'ang rig pa'i rtog pa dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'ang rig pa'i rtog pa dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a syllogism based on the nature of things.

original: sems byung nyid kyis dmigs pa'i phyir /üîΩma rig pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin no sems las byung @92a * //
analyzed: sems byung nyid kyis dmigs pa'i phyir / ma rig pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin no sems las byung @92a * //
translated: Because it is observed to be a mental factor,üîΩignorance is a phenomenon that is a mental factor.

original: ba yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ba yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis dmigs pa ste /
translated: Because it is a cause that is a mental factor, it is observed.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: It apprehends an object and an aspect.

original: rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not of a nature that is without conception.

original: de ltar rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs bar ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa yin par 'dod do //üîΩrtogs pa'i ngo bo yin du zin kyang bden pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa can nam /
analyzed: de ltar rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs bar ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa yin par 'dod do // rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin du zin kyang bden pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa can nam /
translated: Thus, they are associated because they are associated through the same support, the same object, the same aspect, the same time, and the same substance.

original: brdzun pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa can du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa can du 'gyur grang na /
translated: Even though they have the nature of realization, they are either possessed of the aspect of grasping the real or possessed of the aspect of grasping the unreal.

original: re zhig de ni bden pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de ni bden pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not accepted as possessed of the aspect of grasping the real,

original: de ltar 'dzin pa ni shes rab kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa ni shes rab kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because grasping in that way is the characteristic of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir log par dmigs pa ni mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir log par dmigs pa ni mi shes pa yin no //
