translated: Therefore, the non-realization of the object is ignorance.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dmigs par 'dzin pa de ni dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dmigs par 'dzin pa de ni dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which grasps the object is the nature of the one who objectifies.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, consciousness.

original: mi shes pa yang dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mi shes pa yang dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Ignorance is also the grasping of the object. This is a natural inference.

original: sems las byung ba gang zhig gang dang 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ni des bzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba gang zhig gang dang 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ni des bzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Whatever mental factor has a nature that is incompatible with something else is a grasping of the opposite of the aspect apprehended by that other mental factor.

original: dper na mi gtsang ba ni 'dod chags kyis bzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang ba ni 'dod chags kyis bzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the impure is a grasping of the opposite of the aspect apprehended by attachment.üîΩIgnorance also has a nature that is incompatible with the wisdom that apprehends the aspects of the truths.

original: mi shes pa yang bden pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab dang 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa yang bden pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab dang 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: gsung phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo de dang de dag tu shes rab kyis bzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma rig pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsung phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo de dang de dag tu shes rab kyis bzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma rig pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said in this and that s≈´tra that the nature of ignorance is a grasping of the opposite of the aspect apprehended by wisdom.

original: 'di lta ste 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las de la mi shes pa med ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las de la mi shes pa med ba gang zhe na /
translated: For example, in the ƒÄrya Candrapradƒ´pa-samƒÅdhi-s≈´tra, it says: ‚ÄúWhat is the absence of ignorance?

original: gang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos rnams la sgro 'dogs pa med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos rnams la sgro 'dogs pa med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He is not one who superimposes anything on phenomena just as they are.

original: de'i phyir yang phyin ce log tu mi shes pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang phyin ce log tu mi shes pa de nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not one who has distorted understanding.üîΩThus, the S≈´tra on the Ten Stages says,

original: de skad du sa bcu pa'i mdo las de 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩ'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de skad du sa bcu pa'i mdo las de 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te / 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen he observes the origination and destruction of the world, he thinks as follows:

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung @92b ste /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung @92b ste /
translated: ‚ÄòAll the designations of the world arise from the superimposition of self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: If one is free from the superimposition of self, then they do not arise.‚Äô

original: de 'di snyam du sems te byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par 'dod pa can tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba lam log par zhugs
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par 'dod pa can tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba lam log par zhugs
translated: He thinks as follows: ‚ÄòThose who have the mentality of fools, who are obscured by the cataracts of ignorance, who are attached to existence and nonexistence, who have arisen from incorrect mental activity, have entered a mistaken path.

original: pa log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni /
analyzed: pa log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who follow the wrong path

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang sogs te /üîΩ'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye par len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin yang srid pa mngon par grub pa 'byung ba nye bar 'gro ba yin te
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang sogs te / 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye par len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin yang srid pa mngon par grub pa 'byung ba nye bar 'gro ba yin te
translated: accumulate merit, demerit, and unmoving karma.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The seed of mind, which is perfumed by those karmas, is the seed of the mind that is accompanied by outflows and accompanied by appropriation. In the future, it produces the nature of birth and old age and death, and the actualization of the next existence is approached.

original: 'di nyid la yang ma rig pa'i yan lag bstan pas bdag tu lta ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid la yang ma rig pa'i yan lag bstan pas bdag tu lta ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this very life, the member of ignorance is taught, and the view of self is taught.

original: de bas na bden pa rnams la mi shes pa ma rig pa yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de bas na bden pa rnams la mi shes pa ma rig pa yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Therefore, in regard to the truths, ignorance is the non-knowledge of the truths.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci log pa'i shes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci log pa'i shes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: But it should be seen as the knowledge that is the opposite of the nature that has been explained.

original: 'dir yang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba yin no zhes de'i sgo nas ma rig pa kho na bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba yin no zhes de'i sgo nas ma rig pa kho na bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, too, it is the view that is concomitant with ignorance. Thus, it is only ignorance that is indicated by that.

original: de ltar rtogs par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par yang mi bya ste /
translated: But it should not be understood in that way.

original: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo po brjod par bya ba la gzhan bshad na 'chad pa po mi mkhas pa thob pa'i phyir dang / de skad du brjod pa la nges par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo po brjod par bya ba la gzhan bshad na 'chad pa po mi mkhas pa thob pa'i phyir dang / de skad du brjod pa la nges par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the nature of ignorance itself is to be stated, and something else is explained, then the expounder is not skilled in the attainment of the goal, and there is no certainty in the statement.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don rtogs pa yang rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don rtogs pa yang rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the understanding of the meaning as explained is in accordance with reason.

original: de bas na ji skad du bstan pa'i mi shes pa las mi shes pa gzhan bstan pa rigs ldan ma yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du bstan pa'i mi shes pa las mi shes pa gzhan bstan pa rigs ldan ma yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that it is not reasonable to indicate another ignorance from the ignorance that is taught.

original: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya /
analyzed: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya /
translated: The contradiction will be explained here.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi shes pa'i ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi shes pa'i ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the nature of ignorance is established,

original: lung gi phyogs kyi khyad par la 'gal ba 'ga' zhig bzhin du mtshon par bya ba ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba med pas rab tu bstan par bya'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung gi phyogs kyi khyad par la 'gal ba 'ga' zhig bzhin du mtshon par bya ba ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba med pas rab tu bstan par bya'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: The distinctive scriptural passages that are contradictory should be interpreted, as explained above, in such a way that they are not contradictory.

original: gal te 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin pa de'i tshe lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i don 'thad pa ma yin te /üîΩbdag nyid bdag nyid dang mtshungs par @93a * //
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin pa de'i tshe lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i don 'thad pa ma yin te / bdag nyid bdag nyid dang mtshungs par @93a * //
translated: For example, if the view of the transitory collection itself were ignorance, then it would not be tenable to state that ignorance is associated with views,üîΩbecause it is not the case that something is associated with itself, and the view of true existence is not a different object.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa dang bden par blta ba ni don gzhan ma yin no zhes de la 'dir mtshungs par ldan pa nyid pa ni spyor btang ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa dang bden par blta ba ni don gzhan ma yin no zhes de la 'dir mtshungs par ldan pa nyid pa ni spyor btang ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, association does not have the characteristic of being a mere designation,

original: 'on kyang phyogs dang / phyogs can gyi dngos po kun du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs dang / phyogs can gyi dngos po kun du ston pa yin te /
translated: but rather it is the presentation of the relationship between a part and a whole.

original: dper na pa la sha la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i nags dang / lus lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pa la sha la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i nags dang / lus lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a forest is said to possess palasha trees, and a person is said to possess arms.

original: de la 'dir ldan pa nyid la mtshungs par ldan par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir ldan pa nyid la mtshungs par ldan par zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, possession is called ‚Äúassociation.‚Äù

original: lus zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The body is not different from the arms, etc.

original: gang lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the possession of the arms, etc.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: phyogs gcig dang phyogs gcig pa can gyi dngos po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig dang phyogs gcig pa can gyi dngos po bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is the teaching of a thing that has one part and another part.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ma rig pa ni phyogs gcig pa can yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ma rig pa ni phyogs gcig pa can yin la /
translated: In the same way, here, ignorance has one part.

original: de'i phyogs gcig pa'i ngo bo ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig pa'i ngo bo ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin no //
translated: The nature of its one part is the view of the transitory collection.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa ni phyogs gcig pa bstan pa yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa ni phyogs gcig pa bstan pa yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: The purpose of teaching it in this way is to teach its one part. Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said in the appropriate way of the others.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag tu lta ba las byung ba'i skyon thams cad ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag tu lta ba las byung ba'i skyon thams cad ni /
translated: Since this is so, all the faults that arise from the view of the self

original: stong nyid lta dang de 'gal phyir //
analyzed: stong nyid lta dang de 'gal phyir //
translated: Because of the contradiction with the view of emptiness.

original: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of selflessness is contradictory to the view of self.

original: de'i rang bzhin te bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par can dang bdag tu lta ba las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes kun dang lhan cig don gyis /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin te bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par can dang bdag tu lta ba las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes kun dang lhan cig don gyis /
translated: The view of emptiness is the nature of the view of selflessness, and it is contradictory to the view of self, and it is also contradictory to the faults such as the attachment that arises from the view of self.

original: 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin //
analyzed: 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin //
translated: It is well established that they are mutually exclusive.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'gal ba de ni don gyis de'i rang bzhin dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'gal ba de ni don gyis de'i rang bzhin dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is mutually exclusive is necessarily mutually exclusive with the nature of that.

original: dper na grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me ni grang ba'i khyad par ba mo'i reg pa la sogs pa dang / grang ba'i 'bras bu spu long zhes bya ba'i khyad la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin dang ldan cig 'gal ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me ni grang ba'i khyad par ba mo'i reg pa la sogs pa dang / grang ba'i 'bras bu spu long zhes bya ba'i khyad la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin dang ldan cig 'gal ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire, which is mutually exclusive with cold, is mutually exclusive with the nature of cold, such as the sensation of cold to the touch, and with the effect of cold, such as goose bumps.

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba dang yang bdag tu lta ba dang lhan cig 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba dang yang bdag tu lta ba dang lhan cig 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the view of emptiness is incompatible with the view of self. This is a reason from nature.

original: yang na gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni don gyis 'gal zla de dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni don gyis 'gal zla de dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, whatever has a certain nature is by implication incompatible with anything that is incompatible with that nature.

original: dper na sngar bshad pa'i grang ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid ni don @93b gyis grang ba dang 'gal zla me dang 'gal ba yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngar bshad pa'i grang ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid ni don @93b gyis grang ba dang 'gal zla me dang 'gal ba yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the nature of cold, as previously explained, is incompatible with heat, which is incompatible with cold.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And desire, etc., have the nature of the view of the transitory aggregates. This is a reason from nature.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is this reason unestablished.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yar 'dzin pa dag la gnas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir dang ston par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yar 'dzin pa dag la gnas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir dang ston par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For it has already been shown and will be shown again that desire, etc., occur in those who are grounded in the views of ‚Äúme‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de de ltar na bdag med par lta ba skyon gyi gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pas na de goms pa las de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yod na skyon rnams kyang 'jug pa med pa'i chos can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na bdag med par lta ba skyon gyi gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pas na de goms pa las de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yod na skyon rnams kyang 'jug pa med pa'i chos can nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, since the view of selflessness is the antidote to the faults, when one becomes habituated to it, the faults are unable to arise, since they are destroyed.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa las nyon mongs pa rnams ldog tu zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa las nyon mongs pa rnams ldog tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though the afflictions are eliminated by the practice of the antidote,

original: 'di dag yang mi skye ba'i chos can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag yang mi skye ba'i chos can ni ma yin te /
translated: they are not unproduced.

original: srog chags kyi chos nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srog chags kyi chos nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are not unproduced, because they are the nature of living beings, like form, etc.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i rdzas kyi chos 'jig pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i rdzas kyi chos 'jig pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the qualities of substance, such as form, etc., are not destroyed.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni dper na me la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa'i chos bzung ngo //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni de gnas na /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni dper na me la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa'i chos bzung ngo // sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni de gnas na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to such qualities as heat, etc., of fire, etc.

original: zad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zad pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: Whatever is the quality of something does not cease when that exists.üîΩFor example, form, etc., are the qualities of substance.

original: dper na me'i dro ba lta bu'am 'di lta ste gzugs la sogs pa'i de dang ldan pa'i ngo bo zad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i dro ba lta bu'am 'di lta ste gzugs la sogs pa'i de dang ldan pa'i ngo bo zad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the heat of fire, or like the non-exhaustion of the nature of the possessor of form, etc.üîΩAnd attachment, etc. are the nature of living beings.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang srog chags kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang srog chags kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: de la nyes pa rnams shin tu //
analyzed: de la nyes pa rnams shin tu //
translated: In this regard, the faults are:

original: zad min srog chags chos nyid phyir //
analyzed: zad min srog chags chos nyid phyir //
translated: Not the exhaustion of faults, because of the nature of living beings.

original: gzugs sogs bzhin min /
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin min /
translated: Not like form, etc.

original: 'on kyang zad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang zad pa kho na yin no //
translated: But it is just exhaustion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa dang / srog chags 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa dang / srog chags 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: This reason is unestablished, and if no living being exists at all,

original: gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di chos yin /
analyzed: gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di chos yin /
translated: then whose attachment, etc. are these phenomena?

original: 'di thams cad ni rkyen nyid 'di ba tsam 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni rkyen nyid 'di ba tsam 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: All of this is just the conditionality of mere this.

original: de bas na rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir de la rag las pa can gyi skye ba med pa de ltar na ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir de la rag las pa can gyi skye ba med pa de ltar na ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the conditions are incomplete, there is no arising that depends on that. Thus, it is unestablished.

original: 'di la yang srog chags kyis chos nyid du rang bzhin nam de las byung ba la brjod pa yin grang na /
analyzed: 'di la yang srog chags kyis chos nyid du rang bzhin nam de las byung ba la brjod pa yin grang na /

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal @94a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal @94a * //

analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa'i shes pa la yang bdag la skye ba'i gnod pa can yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Nor is there any harm in the cognition of attachment to the view of self that arises from the self. This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it unestablished.

original: bdag tu lta bu'i yul de sun phyung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta bu'i yul de sun phyung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of the view of self has not been refuted.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig yul gang la nyes par mthong ba'i sgo nas sun 'byin bar byed pa ma yin pa de ni de la chags pa skye ba ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig yul gang la nyes par mthong ba'i sgo nas sun 'byin bar byed pa ma yin pa de ni de la chags pa skye ba ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: One who does not refute an object by seeing its faults does not stop the arising of attachment to it.

original: dper na 'dod chags can yul gyi bzang mo la nyes par mthong ba'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags can yul gyi bzang mo la nyes par mthong ba'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lustful person does not refute a beautiful woman by seeing her faults.

original: bdag tu lta ba can yang bdag la nyes par mthong ba'i sgo nas sun 'byin par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can yang bdag la nyes par mthong ba'i sgo nas sun 'byin par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: One who has the view of self does not refute the self by seeing its faults. This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: yang na gang zhig gang la nyes par mthong ba can ma yin pa dang / der 'dod chags skye ba de ni de la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig gang la nyes par mthong ba can ma yin pa dang / der 'dod chags skye ba de ni de la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: Or else, one who does not see a fault in something and who generates attachment to it is not free from attachment to it.

original: dper na 'dod chags can yul gyi bzang mo la nyes par mthong ba med pa 'dod chags skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags can yul gyi bzang mo la nyes par mthong ba med pa 'dod chags skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lustful man who does not see a fault in a beautiful woman generates attachment to her.

original: bdag tu lta ba can yang nyes par mthong ba can ma yin pa dang / der chags pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can yang nyes par mthong ba can ma yin pa dang / der chags pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: One who has the view of self does not see a fault in the self and generates attachment to it. This is the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is not unestablished because it is not accepted by the opponent and because it has already been demonstrated.

original: de de ltar na bdag tu chags pas te /
analyzed: de de ltar na bdag tu chags pas te /
translated: Thus, because of attachment to the self,

original: rgyu'i phyir pa dag gi bde la sred 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir pa dag gi bde la sred 'gyur zhing /
translated: one craves the pleasure of the aggregates.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la chags pa bstan pa de ni da'i bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la chags pa bstan pa de ni da'i bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: One who is attached to something is one who craves the pleasure of that thing.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu'i de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu'i de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the reality of a person who is an ordinary being.

original: skyes bu chags pa dang bral bar mngon par 'dod pa yang phyis kyang chags pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu chags pa dang bral bar mngon par 'dod pa yang phyis kyang chags pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the person who desires to be free from attachment will later show attachment. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar @95b na bdag gi bde ba la sred pas bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du nye bar 'gro ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i skyon rnams yod pa sel bar byed /
analyzed: de ltar @95b na bdag gi bde ba la sred pas bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du nye bar 'gro ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i skyon rnams yod pa sel bar byed /
translated: Thus, the faults of contaminated things, which are approached by the pursuit of one's own happiness through craving for one's own happiness, are removed.

original: yon tan 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should grasp their virtues.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa de ni bdag gi skyon mthong ba can ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa de ni bdag gi skyon mthong ba can ma yin pa'am /
translated: And the application is this: Whoever has craving for his own happiness does not see the faults of his own self,

original: de'i bde ba'i cha shin tu sgrub par byed pa yon tan du lta ba can yin te /
analyzed: de'i bde ba'i cha shin tu sgrub par byed pa yon tan du lta ba can yin te /
translated: or he sees the virtues of his own happiness, which is to be accomplished.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the reality of that very person who is an ordinary being.

original: skyes bu 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par 'dod pa yang bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par 'dod pa yang bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: One who is desirous of being free from passion is also desirous of his own pleasure. This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is a natural reason in relation to the second probandum.

original: de ltar na bde ba sgrub par byed pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba sgrub par byed pa la /
translated: Thus, in the establishment of pleasure,

analyzed: yon tan mthong ba yongs su sred // nga'i zhes de yi sgrub byed len //
translated: one who is desirous of seeing its qualitiesüîΩtakes it up as ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: nga'i nyid du bde ba sgrub par byed pa brtan por yongs su len par byed do //
analyzed: nga'i nyid du bde ba sgrub par byed pa brtan por yongs su len par byed do //
translated: One who is desirous of establishing pleasure as ‚Äúmine‚Äù takes it up firmly.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la yon tan du mthong ba can yongs su srid pa dang ldan pa de ni de la nga'i zhes bya ba'i sems kyi yongs su 'dzin pa brtan po can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la yon tan du mthong ba can yongs su srid pa dang ldan pa de ni de la nga'i zhes bya ba'i sems kyi yongs su 'dzin pa brtan po can du 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: One who is desirous of seeing its qualities takes it up as ‚Äúmine‚Äù and becomes one who has a firm grasping of the mind that thinks ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

analyzed: dper na sngon gyi gnas skabs kyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //

original: skyes bu chags pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i yang bdag gi dngos pe la phyis kyang yon tan du mthong ba can gyi yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //

translated: The person who is free from attachment is also one who is attached to his own self, because he sees good qualities in it. This is a natural inference.

original: skyes bu bdag tu mthong bas bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'i sred pas yon tan du mthong ba can gyi yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa rtsom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khor ba yongs su 'dzin pa gang

translated: The person who sees a self and is attached to it because of craving, etc., is attached to it because he sees good qualities in it. He is attached to the self, and he is attached to the cycle of existence, which is characterized by the beginningless grasping of the self, etc.

original: yin pa / des ni ji srid bdag mngon chags //
analyzed: yin pa / des ni ji srid bdag mngon chags //
translated: As long as he is attached to the self,

original: de srid du 'khor bar yongs su 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩbdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
analyzed: de srid du 'khor bar yongs su 'jug par 'gyur ro // bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
translated: he will be engaged in the cycle of existence.üîΩWhen there is a self, one knows another.

original: ji srid du blo bdag ces mngon par zhen pa de srid du bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / de yod na de ltar mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: ji srid du blo bdag ces mngon par zhen pa de srid du bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / de yod na de ltar mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa /
translated: As long as the mind is attached to the self, there is the notion of a self, and when there is the notion of a self, there is the notion of another.

analyzed: de thams cad gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'du shes pa'o //
translated: All of these are other. This is the notion of other.

original: de de lta @96a * //
analyzed: de de lta @96a * //
translated: In this way,üîΩthrough the notion of self and other, there is grasping and aversion.

original: bu'i blos / bdag gzhan cha las 'dzin dang sdang // bdag nyid du bzung ba las yongs su 'dzin pa ni mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: bu'i blos / bdag gzhan cha las 'dzin dang sdang // bdag nyid du bzung ba las yongs su 'dzin pa ni mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: From the grasping of self, there is attachment, which is the taking up of what is not given.

analyzed: gzhan nyid du rnam par phye ba las sdang ba yin te yongs su dor ba'o //

analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang sdang bdag ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yin te /

original: 'di dag dang ni kun 'brel las //
analyzed: 'di dag dang ni kun 'brel las //
translated: From their connection,

analyzed: ji srid du phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur /

original: ji srid du 'khor ba pa yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du 'khor ba pa yin no //
translated: As long as these exist, one is in cyclic existence.

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since the view of self does not exist,

original: de dag thams cad yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na bdag med par mthong ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang / de'i rang bzhin can gyi nyes pa rnams kyis gnod pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na bdag med par mthong ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang / de'i rang bzhin can gyi nyes pa rnams kyis gnod pa can nyid yin no //

original: gal te ji ltar bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na yang bdag gi chags pa dang bral ba 'khor bar 'khor ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na yang bdag gi chags pa dang bral ba 'khor bar 'khor ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if one has attachment to self, one is not liberated from cyclic existence.üîΩThis is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: For,

original: 'di ltar skyes bu bdag la chags par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu bdag la chags par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If a person were attached to self,

original: de yi la nges chags bral min //
analyzed: de yi la nges chags bral min //

analyzed: longs spyod la rag lus pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis bdag gir byed pa la chags pa dang bral pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the self is the basis of appropriation, one who is attached to the self is not detached from attachment to appropriation.

original: de ltar na bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa'i bdag gi dang 'brel pa tsam gyis byas pa'i chags pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩgang zhig bdag la chags pa de ni nges par bdag dang 'brel pa can gyi dbang po la sogs pa la chags pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa'i bdag gi dang 'brel pa tsam gyis byas pa'i chags pa yod pa ma yin no // gang zhig bdag la chags pa de ni nges par bdag dang 'brel pa can gyi dbang po la sogs pa la chags pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one who has attachment to the self does not have attachment to action merely through the connection of the self and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

analyzed: dper na snga ma'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: One who is attached to the self is certainly attached to the self‚Äôs appendages, such as the faculties, just as that person is attached to his former state.

analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang phyis kyang bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This person, later on, will be attached to himself. This is a natural reason.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it unestablished.üîΩFor,

analyzed: 'di ltar / nyes med bdag la chags pa dang // bral ba'i rgyu ni yod ma yin //

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sdug bsngal dang bal zhing rnam par 'tshe ba med par 'dod pa de ni /üîΩde la 'dod chags dang bral ba'am //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sdug bsngal dang bal zhing rnam par 'tshe ba med par 'dod pa de ni / de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'am //
translated: The application is this: Whoever desires that someone be free from suffering and harm

original: zhen pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhen pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: is not free from attachmentüîΩto that person.

original: dper na snga ma'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid @96b bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snga ma'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid @96b bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the person who previously had a self and was attached to it.

original: bdag tu smra ba'ang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang bdag sdug bsngal dang bral zhing rnam par 'tshe ba med par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa nyid kyis dor bar bya ba yin te /

analyzed: sbrul gyis zin pa'i sor mo bzhin no zhes de ltar gzhan dag sems so //

analyzed: 'di nyid la mi mnyes pas gal te chags pas nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: But if attachment is faulty because of being disagreeable to the self,

analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhes 'dri ba mdzad pa yin no //
translated: what is the consequence of that?

original: bdag tu chags pa skyon dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa skyon dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because attachment to the self is faulty,

analyzed: de spangs yin zhes smras so //

analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na / bdag tu chags pa 'di yi yul //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.üîΩThe object of this attachment to self

analyzed: bdag gang yin pa de yul med pa nyid du /
translated: is the self.

original: sun phyung med par ni /
analyzed: sun phyung med par ni /

analyzed: de spangs par ni nus ma yin //

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la chags pa skye ba'i yul gyi nyes pa mthong ba med pa des ni de la chags pa spong bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument is this: One who does not see the faults of the object of attachment cannot abandon attachment to it.

analyzed: dper na 'dod chags can yul gyi bzang mo la chags pa'i yul gyi nyes pa mthong ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: skyes bu 'dis kyang bdag tu chags pa'i yul gyi nyes pa ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This man also does not see the faults of the object of attachment to the self. This is a nonobservation of a cause.

analyzed: yon tan skyon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //

analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu mtshan mthong bas phrag dog la sogs pa skye ba bzung ngo //

original: de ltar @97a * //
analyzed: de ltar @97a * //

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whoever meditates on suffering in regard to something is free from attachment to it.

original: dper na skyes bu sbrul gyis yan lag bzung ba sgom pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu sbrul gyis yan lag bzung ba sgom pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a man who is bitten by a snake meditates on suffering in regard to the limb that is bitten.üîΩAnd a man who desires liberation meditates on suffering in regard to the self, attachment to the self, etc.

original: skyes bu grol bar 'dod pa yang bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
analyzed: skyes bu grol bar 'dod pa yang bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: bdag gi blo ni bcom pas 'dir //
analyzed: bdag gi blo ni bcom pas 'dir //
translated: The idea of self is destroyed,üîΩand so the limb is abandoned,

original: dor ba yin gyi bzlog la min //
analyzed: dor ba yin gyi bzlog la min //
translated: but not by reversing the idea.

original: ji srid du sbrul gyis bzung ba'i yan lag la longs spyod pa'i rten gyi blo nyams pa med pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du sbrul gyis bzung ba'i yan lag la longs spyod pa'i rten gyi blo nyams pa med pa de srid du /
translated: As long as the idea of the limb as a basis of experience is not destroyed by the bite of the snake,

original: dor bar spro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dor bar spro ba ma yin no //
translated: I do not want to abandon it.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin du /
translated: When it is not in its natural state,

original: gnas par ma gyur pa na man chad yan lag 'di longs spyod pa'i rten ma yin no zhes de la bdag gi blo 'dor bar byed pa de'i tshe yan lag de dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas par ma gyur pa na man chad yan lag 'di longs spyod pa'i rten ma yin no zhes de la bdag gi blo 'dor bar byed pa de'i tshe yan lag de dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then I will abandon the idea of self with regard to it, and then I will abandon the limb.

original: 'dis ni ma nges pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma nges pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is not definite.

original: de pas na ji srid du bdag gi blo yod pa de srid du dor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de pas na ji srid du bdag gi blo yod pa de srid du dor ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, as long as the idea of self exists, it is not abandoned.üîΩThe body is grasped as the basis

original: @99a * // dbang po la sogs longs spyod pa'i //üîΩrten nyid du ni bzung ba la //
analyzed: @99a * // dbang po la sogs longs spyod pa'i // rten nyid du ni bzung ba la //
translated: for the enjoyment of the faculties, etc.

original: longs spyod pa'i rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du bzung ba la'o //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du bzung ba la'o //
translated: The body is grasped as the basis for the enjoyment of the faculties, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the body faculty, etc.üîΩHow can one turn away the idea of self with regard to it?

original: rang nyid blo ni gang gis bzlog / de la chags bral de gang las yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang nyid blo ni gang gis bzlog / de la chags bral de gang las yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: From what is it detached? It is not detached from anything.

original: de ltar na de ni skye bo thams cad kyi ni mngon sum yin /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni skye bo thams cad kyi ni mngon sum yin /
translated: In this way, it is evident to everyone.

original: dper na lus la skra sogs bog pa na /
analyzed: dper na lus la skra sogs bog pa na /
translated: For example, when hair, etc. is removed from the body,

original: yan lag dang nying lag khyad par med pa yon tan dang skyon dang ldan par mtshungs pa de 'dra ba 'ba' zhig la /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag khyad par med pa yon tan dang skyon dang ldan par mtshungs pa de 'dra ba 'ba' zhig la /
translated: The body is a collection of parts, and the parts are not distinguished as to being either good or bad.

original: skyon bcas blo ni skye 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon bcas blo ni skye 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is born with a fault.

original: rang gi blo ni ma rtogs te //
analyzed: rang gi blo ni ma rtogs te //
translated: The mind does not understand itself.

original: nga'i longs spyod kyi rten sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes blo dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i longs spyod kyi rten sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes blo dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is devoid of the idea that it is the basis of the enjoyment of the self, which is the producer of the body.

original: gzhan la chags bcas skye 'gyur ltar /
analyzed: gzhan la chags bcas skye 'gyur ltar /
translated: The mind is born with a fault, just as it is born with a fault in regard to another.

original: skra la sogs pa lus las tha dad par ma gyur pa bdag gi nyid du kun nas bzung ba yod na chags pa'i blo 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa lus las tha dad par ma gyur pa bdag gi nyid du kun nas bzung ba yod na chags pa'i blo 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The mind is born with a fault in regard to the hair and so on, which are not different from the body, because it grasps them as its own.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis longs spyod kyi rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du bzung ba de la de'i rang gi blo nyid ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis longs spyod kyi rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du bzung ba de la de'i rang gi blo nyid ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: The mind does not turn away from the idea that that which is grasped as the basis of the enjoyment of the self is itself.

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid kyi lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa la rang nyid kyi blo lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid kyi lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa la rang nyid kyi blo lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the mind in regard to the body and the sense faculties of the person who is in the previous state.

original: skyes bu 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pas kyang phyis kyi lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa yang longs spyod kyi rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pas kyang phyis kyi lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa yang longs spyod kyi rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Even a person who is free from attachment would later grasp the body faculty and so on as the basis of enjoyment. This is the observation of a contradictory cause.

original: gang zhig gis rang gi nyid du bzung ba de la ni chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gis rang gi nyid du bzung ba de la ni chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: One who grasps something as his own is not free from attachment.

original: dper na sngar gyi gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngar gyi gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like that very person in a previous state.

original: skyes bu 'dis kyang phyis kyi lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa rang gi nyid du bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩgang zhig gang yod na 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dis kyang phyis kyi lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa rang gi nyid du bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur zhing /
translated: This person also grasps the body faculty and so on as his own later. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de las gzhan pa yod na yang med par 'gyur ba yin pa de ni de las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yod na yang med par 'gyur ba yin pa de ni de las 'gyur te /
translated: That which exists when something exists and does not exist when it does not exist is derived from that.

original: dper na sa bon las 'byung ba'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon las 'byung ba'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout is derived from a seed.

original: bdag la gnas pa'i skra dang sen mo dang 'chil  ma la sogs pa la chags pa dang bral ba med pa yang bdag gi blo yod na 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa'i skra dang sen mo dang 'chil  ma la sogs pa la chags pa dang bral ba med pa yang bdag gi blo yod na 'gyur zhing /
translated: There would be no difference between the body and the hair, nails, and so on, that are on the body, because the thought of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would exist in relation to them.

original: lus las 'bogs pa dag la de yod pa'i phyir khyad par med pa la yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin @99b gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus las 'bogs pa dag la de yod pa'i phyir khyad par med pa la yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin @99b gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: ‚Äú But that is so!‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pa goms ba las bdag nyid du chags pa la sogs pa spong ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pa goms ba las bdag nyid du chags pa la sogs pa spong ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: When one is accustomed to cultivating the thought of the body as impure, one abandons attachment to the body.

original: gang zhig gang gis rang gi nyid du bzung ba zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis rang gi nyid du bzung ba zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú But the reason is not established, because it is not certain that one who has the thought of the body as impure will abandon attachment to the body.‚Äù

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / de la rang blo 'phrod 'du ba //üîΩla sogs 'brel pas skyed yin na //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te / 'di ltar / de la rang blo 'phrod 'du ba // la sogs 'brel pas skyed yin na //
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause attachment and so onüîΩarise from the connection of one‚Äôs mind with the body.

original: chags pa la sogs pa la rang gi blo bdag la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i 'brel pa las yin no //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa la rang gi blo bdag la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i 'brel pa las yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on arise from the connection of one‚Äôs mind with the body.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni lus longs spyod kyi rten nyid dang / dbang po longs spyod kyis sgrub par byed pa nyid 'brel pa las skye ba bzung ngo //üîΩ'brel pa nyid kyang chags pa dang bral ba 'dod pa'i gnas skabs yin na yang /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni lus longs spyod kyi rten nyid dang / dbang po longs spyod kyis sgrub par byed pa nyid 'brel pa las skye ba bzung ngo // 'brel pa nyid kyang chags pa dang bral ba 'dod pa'i gnas skabs yin na yang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text includes the following two types of relations: the relation of the body and the enjoyments as the basis, and the relation of the faculties and the enjoyments as the means of attainment.üîΩEven when one is free from attachment, the relation of the body and the enjoyments as the basis and the relation of the faculties and the enjoyments as the means of attainment still exist.

original: de bzhin yin snga ma bzhin du ma tshang ba nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin yin snga ma bzhin du ma tshang ba nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the relation of the body and the enjoyments as the basis and the relation of the faculties and the enjoyments as the means of attainment still exist.

original: bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa de ltar mthong yang /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa de ltar mthong yang /
translated: Even though one sees the faults of attachment to a self and so on,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa las skye ba'i bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la rang nyid kyi blo bcom pa min /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa las skye ba'i bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la rang nyid kyi blo bcom pa min /
translated: one‚Äôs mind is not destroyed with regard to the attachment to a self that arises from the relation of the body and the enjoyments as the basis and the faculties and the enjoyments as the means of attainment.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la gang gis shes pa skyed pa de ni yod na 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la gang gis shes pa skyed pa de ni yod na 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: When something is the cause of the arising of a cognition of something else, it is not destroyed when it exists.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa las skye zhing 'byung ba'i myu gu la de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa las skye zhing 'byung ba'i myu gu la de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a seed is the cause of the arising of a sprout, and the cognition that designates it as the effect of the seed exists.

original: chags pa la sogs pa la rang gi nyid kyi shes pa yang 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel bas skyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa la rang gi nyid kyi shes pa yang 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel bas skyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are produced by the mind that is related to them by the relation of inherence. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: gang yang grangs can 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel bas bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa rang gi blo skyed pa gang yin pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin pas grol bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang yang grangs can 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel bas bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa rang gi blo skyed pa gang yin pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin pas grol bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya may think, ‚ÄúWhatever is produced by the mind that is related to attachment and so on by the relation of inherence is not free from attachment and so on. Therefore it is not liberated.

original: kho bo cag gis ni ji srid du rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag la gcig nyid du nges pa can gyi blo yod pa de srid du 'khor ba yin zhing /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni ji srid du rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag la gcig nyid du nges pa can gyi blo yod pa de srid du 'khor ba yin zhing /
translated: But we assert that as long as the mind that ascertains the self and the person to be the same exists, there is cyclic existence.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin dang skyes bu gzhan nyid yin par shes pa de'i tshe rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pa'i phyir grol ba yin no zhes sems na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin dang skyes bu gzhan nyid yin par shes pa de'i tshe rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pa'i phyir grol ba yin no zhes sems na /
translated: When one understands that the self and the person are different, then one is liberated because one understands the difference between the self and the person.‚Äù

original: de dang de yang de la rang gi blo'i 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs 'brel pas skyed yin na zhes bya ba der sogs pa smos pas bsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dang de yang de la rang gi blo'i 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs 'brel pas skyed yin na zhes bya ba der sogs pa smos pas bsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: And that is also the case for that, because of the connection with the convergence of one's own mind and so on.

original: de ltar yang @100a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang @100a * //
translated: If it were produced by that, the word 'and so on' would be superfluous.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is to be stated as follows:

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pa med pa'i phyir bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la rang gi blo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pa med pa'i phyir bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la rang gi blo ma yin gyi /
translated: Because there is no knowledge of the difference between nature and person, it is not one's own mind in attachment to self and so on.

original: 'on kyang longs spyod kyi yan lag nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang longs spyod kyi yan lag nyid kyis yin no //
translated: However, it is due to the aspect of enjoyment.

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi dngos po tha dad pa dag ni blo gcig gi rgyu ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi dngos po tha dad pa dag ni blo gcig gi rgyu ma yin na /
translated: Thus, if external things that are different are not the cause of one cognition,

original: de dag la rang gi blor phan 'dogs par byed pa'i sgo nas 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag la rang gi blor phan 'dogs par byed pa'i sgo nas 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: they are also so in terms of benefiting one's own mind.

original: 'phrod pa 'du sogs med na yang //üîΩ'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi don /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du sogs med na yang // 'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi don /
translated: Even without convergence and so on,üîΩthere is benefit for all external objects

original: thams cad la ni phan 'dogs yod //
analyzed: thams cad la ni phan 'dogs yod //
translated: that are not conducive to convergence.

original: rang gi blo'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag la gcig nyid du nges par byas pa'i rang gi blo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi blo'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag la gcig nyid du nges par byas pa'i rang gi blo ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition that ascertains the self and the person to be identical is not correct,

original: de med na yang phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i sgo nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na yang phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i sgo nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though they do not exist, they are still the objects of benefit and the benefactors.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med na yang gang yod na yod pa de ni de la ltos ba med cing des byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med na yang gang yod na yod pa de ni de la ltos ba med cing des byas pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: That which exists when this exists and does not exist when that does not exist is not dependent on that and is not created by that.

original: dper na nas kyi sa bon med du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na nas kyi sa bon med du zin kyang /
translated: For example, even though the barley seed does not exist,

original: s'a lu'i sa bon yod na yod pa'i s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon yod na yod pa'i s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: the rice sprout exists when the rice seed exists.

original: rang gi blo yang gcig nyid du shes pa med na yang phyi rol gyi don dag la phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byad pa'i dngos po'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rang gi blo yang gcig nyid du shes pa med na yang phyi rol gyi don dag la phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byad pa'i dngos po'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition of the self also exists with regard to external objects, even though the cognition of the self as identical does not exist. The knowledge of the objects of benefit and the benefactors exists. This is a natural inference.üîΩThe self is not the object of benefit of the self,

original: bdag ni gal te sdug bsngal rten yin phyir /
analyzed: bdag ni gal te sdug bsngal rten yin phyir /
translated: because the self is the basis of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal nye par 'jog par phyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa de la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nye par 'jog par phyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa de la /
translated: The body faculty, etc., are to be rejected because they are the cause of the experience of suffering.

original: rang blo mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang blo mi 'gyur /
translated: One‚Äôs own mind does not turn to them,

original: rang nyid kyi blo nyid sbrul gyis zin pa'i sor mo bzhin /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi blo nyid sbrul gyis zin pa'i sor mo bzhin /
translated: just as one would reject a finger seized by a snake.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba dor bar bya ba yin no des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba dor bar bya ba yin no des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin pa de la ni rang gi blor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin pa de la ni rang gi blor mi 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: One‚Äôs own mind does not turn to that which is the cause of an unwanted feeling.

original: dper na sprul gyis bzung ba'i sor mo dor bar bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul gyis bzung ba'i sor mo dor bar bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one would reject a finger seized by a snake.

original: bdag dang lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The collection of the self, body, faculties, etc., is the cause of unwanted feeling. This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: gcig tu de ni sdug bsngal min //
analyzed: gcig tu de ni sdug bsngal min //
translated: It is not exclusively suffering.

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa de dang de ni nges par sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa de dang de ni nges par sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin /
translated: That body, faculties, etc., are not definitely the cause of suffering.

original: rnam grangs kyis bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyang 'di la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyang 'di la yod pa yin no //
translated: And it is also a cause of pleasure in a secondary sense.

original: des na sdug bsngal skyed par @100b byed pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal skyed par @100b byed pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, even though it is a cause of suffering,

original: rnam pa gang gis bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i bde ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i cha de tsam gyis bde ba'i longs spyod kyi rten byed pa can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i bde ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i cha de tsam gyis bde ba'i longs spyod kyi rten byed pa can yin pa de ltar na /

analyzed: bdag tu chags pa dor ba med na /
translated: If one does not give up attachment to self,

original: bdag gi chags pa dor bar bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi chags pa dor bar bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: one cannot give up attachment to what is mine.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la chags pa dor pa med pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral pa'i phyir brtson pa dang ldan yang /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la chags pa dor pa med pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral pa'i phyir brtson pa dang ldan yang /
translated: The application is this: One who does not give up attachment to something, even though he may be diligent in order to be free from attachment to it,

original: 'ba' zhig gi tshe de'i yon tan gyi cha mthong ba'i phyir de la rjes su chags pa rjes su sbyor ba dang / de'i skyon mthong ba la sgrib par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi tshe de'i yon tan gyi cha mthong ba'i phyir de la rjes su chags pa rjes su sbyor ba dang / de'i skyon mthong ba la sgrib par byed pa yin te /

original: dper na bu nyes pa can 'ba' zhig la so so'i skye bo'i chags pa mi 'dor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu nyes pa can 'ba' zhig la so so'i skye bo'i chags pa mi 'dor ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, an ordinary man does not give up attachment to a son who is all wrong.

original: skyes bu 'dis kyang bdag gi chags pa dor ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dis kyang bdag gi chags pa dor ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This person also does not give up attachment to self. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te bdag la chags bral yang //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te bdag la chags bral yang //
translated: This is true,üîΩbut if one is free from attachment to self,

original: ji ltar bdag gi dang bral ba de ltar bdag la chags pa yang spong ba nyid @102b yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi dang bral ba de ltar bdag la chags pa yang spong ba nyid @102b yin no //
translated: then just as he is free from attachment to what is mine, so he is free from attachment to self.

original: de bas na bdag tu chags pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs bshad pa thams cad ma grub ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na bdag tu chags pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs bshad pa thams cad ma grub ba yin no zhe na /

original: de ni 'dir nyes med gang la chags pa dang bral ba'i rgyu ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni 'dir nyes med gang la chags pa dang bral ba'i rgyu ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that there is no cause for freedom from attachment to that which is non-existent.

original: gzhan yang bdag la chags pa dang bral ba yang bla ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag la chags pa dang bral ba yang bla ste /
translated: Moreover, it is better to be free from attachment to a self.

original: de ltar na yang gang la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gang la /
translated: Even so, to whom

original: 'di la chags pa bral 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la chags pa bral 'gyur na /

original: de la 'di 'dor ma yin dper bdag bzhin /
analyzed: de la 'di 'dor ma yin dper bdag bzhin /
translated: One would not abandon it, just as I do not abandon myself.

original: skyes bu bdag la chags pa dang bral du zin kyang bdag spong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu bdag la chags pa dang bral du zin kyang bdag spong ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though a person is freed from attachment to a self, he does not abandon the self.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi yang chags pa dang bral na yang de dor bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi yang chags pa dang bral na yang de dor bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In the same way, even though one is freed from attachment to a self, one does not abandon it.

original: de phyir sdug bsngal sgom don med //
analyzed: de phyir sdug bsngal sgom don med //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to cultivate the perception of suffering.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal bsgom pa sdug bsngal dor ba'i rgyu mtshan 'dod chags dang bral ba kun nas byed pa'i phyir tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal bsgom pa sdug bsngal dor ba'i rgyu mtshan 'dod chags dang bral ba kun nas byed pa'i phyir tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, one cultivates the perception of suffering as the cause for abandoning suffering, because it is the cause for freedom from attachment.

original: gang gi tshe des kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa yod na yang bdag dor ba nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe des kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa yod na yang bdag dor ba nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one has attained freedom from attachment, even though it exists, it is not abandoned.

original: de dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal bsgoms pas bdag gi yang dor bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal bsgoms pas bdag gi yang dor bar mi 'gyur ro // sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba ni /

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not occur when something exists does not have that as its cause.

original: dper na nas kyi sa bon yod na yang s'a lu'i myu gu mi 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nas kyi sa bon yod na yang s'a lu'i myu gu mi 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even though barley seeds exist, a rice sprout does not occur.

original: bdag dor ba yang 'dod chags dang bral ba yod kyang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed ba 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dor ba yang 'dod chags dang bral ba yod kyang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed ba 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is: The abandonment of the self does not occur when freedom from attachment exists.

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba las sdug bsngal spong ngo zhes 'di 'khrul par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba las sdug bsngal spong ngo zhes 'di 'khrul par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is a mistake to say that suffering is abandoned by freedom from attachment.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yod du zin kyang 'dor bar nus ba can gyi sdug bsngal dor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yod du zin kyang 'dor bar nus ba can gyi sdug bsngal dor ba yin gyi /

original: bdag dor bar nus pa can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag dor bar nus pa can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not able to abandon the self.

original: de'i tshe sdug bsngal 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bdag dang ma bral na de yang ldog pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na bdag gi yang dor ba nyid ma yin pa'am /

original: de'i yod na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yod na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference between them in terms of the existence of that.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi 'byung ba ni bsgoms pas byas pa'i mngon sum las kyang med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsdug bsngal bsgoms pas kyang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi 'byung ba ni bsgoms pas byas pa'i mngon sum las kyang med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / sdug bsngal bsgoms pas kyang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that freedom from attachment does not arise from the direct perception that is created by meditation,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúEven through meditating on suffering, those who meditate on the absence of self do not become free from attachment to the suffering that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.‚Äù

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de dag sdug bsngal nyid ni rnam par bsgom par 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du byed pa yin gyi /

original: lhag par byed par nus pa ma yin na /
analyzed: lhag par byed par nus pa ma yin na /

original: gang las dal 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur lung las bstan pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gang las dal 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur lung las bstan pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de /

original: gang bsgoms pas bsgom par bya ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: gang bsgoms pas bsgom par bya ba gang yin pa /
translated: What is to be abandoned by the path of meditation?

original: de sngar yang ni mngon sum nyid /
analyzed: de sngar yang ni mngon sum nyid /
translated: That was previously made manifest.

original: de'i yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i yin par 'gyur na /

original: de ltar yang chags bral ldan ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang chags bral ldan ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be possessed by one who is free from attachment.

original: de ltar na bsgoms pas kyang sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas pa can 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgoms pas kyang sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas pa can 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even though one cultivates the perception of suffering, one does not become free from attachment.

original: grol ba'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgoms pa tsam ston pa'i bstan bcos kyis ma mthong ba cung zad kyang bstan pa med de /
analyzed: grol ba'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgoms pa tsam ston pa'i bstan bcos kyis ma mthong ba cung zad kyang bstan pa med de /
translated: There is not the slightest thing that is not seen in the treatise that teaches the cultivation of suffering for the sake of liberation.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal bsgoms pas rnam par bsgoms pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rgyur rtag pa ma yin pa de ltar na de ston par byed pa yin du zin kyang bstan bcos kyi 'bras bu med pa nyid yin no //
