original: kho bo cag gi ni sngar bdag med pa nyid ma mthong ba phyis bsgoms pas mngon sum du byas pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rigs ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ni sngar bdag med pa nyid ma mthong ba phyis bsgoms pas mngon sum du byas pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rigs ba yin no //
translated: But for us, it is reasonable that one who previously did not see selflessness later becomes free from attachment by cultivating it and making it manifest.

original: sbyor ba yang gang bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa de ni sdug bsngal mngon du mthong du zin kyang /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa de ni sdug bsngal mngon du mthong du zin kyang /
translated: The application is this: One who is attached to self, even though he sees suffering,

original: de las 'dod chags dang bral bar nye bar 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de las 'dod chags dang bral bar nye bar 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: But he does not approach freedom from attachment,

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: just like that very person who is in the state of an ordinary being.

original: sdug bsngal mngon sum du mthong bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu de yang phyis kyang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon sum du mthong bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu de yang phyis kyang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that person who desires to see suffering directly also later possesses attachment to self. This is the observation of a contradictory cause.

original: gal te la lar nyes pa mthong ba las skyes bu 'dod chags dang bral ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te la lar nyes pa mthong ba las skyes bu 'dod chags dang bral ba mthong ngo //
translated: If you see a person who is free from attachment because of seeing faults somewhere,

original: des na gang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa de ni sdug bsngal @103b mngon sum du mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs ma nges pa'am /üîΩma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa de ni sdug bsngal @103b mngon sum du mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs ma nges pa'am / ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then the reason in the proof that ‚Äúone who possesses attachment to self, even though one sees suffering directly, and so on‚Äù is either indefinite or unestablished.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de ltar na gal te gcig la'ang bdag gis bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig la /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te gcig la'ang bdag gis bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig la /
translated: If it were so, then it would follow that even in the case of a single person, the person would sometimes be accepted as the one who achieves happiness and sometimes as the one who experiences suffering.

original: nyes pa 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: nyes pa 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: But when he sees some fault in her,

original: skad cig de la blo ldog ste //
analyzed: skad cig de la blo ldog ste //
translated: he turns away from her in an instant.

original: ji srid nyes pa mthong ba'i bar la rjes su chags pa can gyi skyes bu'i'o //
analyzed: ji srid nyes pa mthong ba'i bar la rjes su chags pa can gyi skyes bu'i'o //
translated: This is the person who is attached to the object as long as he sees only its good qualities.

original: de ltar na yang de la yang nyes pa bzung ba can gyi yul la de shin tu 'dod chags bral ba nyid ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de la yang nyes pa bzung ba can gyi yul la de shin tu 'dod chags bral ba nyid ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: But even in this case, when he sees a fault in the object, he is not completely free from attachment to it,

original: yul can thams cad kyi chags pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can thams cad kyi chags pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has not eliminated attachment to all objects.

original: yon tan mthong ba las kyang rnam grangs kyi rjes su chags pa can nyid srid pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba las kyang rnam grangs kyi rjes su chags pa can nyid srid pa yin no //
translated: And it is possible that he will become attached to the object again when he sees its good qualities.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is the analogy?

original: 'dod ldan bud med gzhan la bzhin //
analyzed: 'dod ldan bud med gzhan la bzhin //
translated: Like a lustful man with another woman.

original: dper na 'dod pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig bud med gzhan la skyon cung zad mthong bas chags pa dang bral ba gzhan la chags pa dang ma bral pa nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig bud med gzhan la skyon cung zad mthong bas chags pa dang bral ba gzhan la chags pa dang ma bral pa nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lustful man, seeing some slight fault in one woman, becomes detached from her, but he is not free from attachment to all women.

original: yul gzhan la 'byung ba can gyi 'dod chags kyi lhag ma ni bud med de la yang 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la 'byung ba can gyi 'dod chags kyi lhag ma ni bud med de la yang 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The remainder of attachment to another object becomes the cause of attachment to that woman.

original: de ltar na rnam grangs kyis yon tan mthong ba lhan cig byed pa yod na yang du sa gcig gi tshe sngar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yul du gyur pa'i bud med de nyid la yang 'dod chags dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam grangs kyis yon tan mthong ba lhan cig byed pa yod na yang du sa gcig gi tshe sngar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yul du gyur pa'i bud med de nyid la yang 'dod chags dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: Thus, even when the cause is present, one who sees the variety of qualities will not be attached to that very woman who was the object of his previous attachment.

original: shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, he is not completely free from attachment.

original: 'di ltar blang dang dor ba'i khyad yod na //
analyzed: 'di ltar blang dang dor ba'i khyad yod na //
translated: For, when there is a difference in what is to be accepted and what is to be rejected,

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig dor bar bya ba yin //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig dor bar bya ba yin //
translated: some man is to be rejected.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod chags par bya ba ma yin pa'i bud med lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod chags par bya ba ma yin pa'i bud med lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a woman who is not to be desired.

original: 'ga' zhig blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Some is to be accepted.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod chags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod chags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a woman who is to be desired.

original: de ltar na blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba sna tshogs pa nyid yod na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba sna tshogs pa nyid yod na'o //
translated: Thus, when there is a variety of what is to be accepted and what is to be rejected,

translated: Attachment is the seed of the desire to appropriate.üîΩIt is the seed of the desire to appropriate, because it is the cause of the desire to appropriate the object that one wants to appropriate.üîΩAttachment is the seed of the desire to appropriate, because it is the cause of the desire to appropriate the object that one wants to appropriate.

original: sa bon yin te rgyu mtshan yin no //üîΩrnam grangs kyis bskyed tshe /
analyzed: sa bon yin te rgyu mtshan yin no // rnam grangs kyis bskyed tshe /
translated: Attachment is the seed of the desire to appropriate, because it is the cause of the desire to appropriate the object that one wants to appropriate.

original: chags pa rnams kyi sa bon du 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di dus gcig gi tshe bdag gi 'ga' zhig la gang 'dod chags @104a * //üîΩdang bral bar 'gyur ba de ltar na yang /

translated: Also, with regard to others who possess good qualities,

original: gtso ba dbang po la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso ba dbang po la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di las bdag gi mig la sogs pa gzhan khyad par can du gyur cig snyam pa yin gyi nga'i bdag gzhan du gyur cig ces ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gang gi tshe yang nga'i bdag 'di lta bur gyur cig ces don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba de yang bdag gnas pa'i skabs don du gnyer ba yin gyi /

original: bdag gzhan don du gnyer ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gzhan don du gnyer ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who has a mind is different from the eye, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la 'di las khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan du gyur cig cas mchog gzhan don du gnyer ba dang ldan pa de ni bdag las tha dad pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin te /

translated: For example, Devadatta seeks a different, superior self in a cow, etc., thinking, ‚ÄúMay I become different from this and superior.‚Äù

analyzed: @107a * // skyes bu 'di yang mig la sogs pa mchog gzhan don du gnyer ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //

original: skye 'jig blo can nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: skye 'jig blo can nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because he has a mind that is born and perishes.

original: 'dis kyang bdag gnas pa nyid du mthong bas skra dang sen mo dang yan lag dang mig la sogs pa skye ba dang 'jig pa'i blo dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir gcig tu zhe na pa can ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na skyes bu ri bo la gnas pa la lha'i gnas skye ba dang 'jig pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin pa lta bu'o //

original: de phyir rang bzhin dang skyes bu gcig nyid mthong bas kyang /
analyzed: de phyir rang bzhin dang skyes bu gcig nyid mthong bas kyang /

analyzed: bdag gi la chags min /

analyzed: de med na yang yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med na yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /

analyzed: bdag gi rgyu gzhan de yang gang zhe na //

original: ngo bo nyid kyis te /

analyzed: de ni bdag gi la chags pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: 'di'i zab po ste /

original: bdag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la longs spyad par bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni za ba por yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta @110a * //üîΩbu'o // bdag grol bar 'dod ba'i yang bdag gi'i longs spyad par bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub pa yin no zhes smra ba de'i tshe 'di 'dod ba ma yin te /

analyzed: gang gi tshe las rnams mi byed cing las byas pa rnams kyi yang 'bras bu nyams su mi myong ba de'i tshe de bdag med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /

analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi'o //

original: gal te de dag med pa yin no zhe na de ni bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag med pa yin no zhe na de ni bdag ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //

analyzed: dper na ro bong gi rva lta bu'o //

analyzed: bdag grol bar 'dod pa yang mi byed cing las byas pa'i 'bras bu longs mi spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with its nature.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, seeing selflessness is the path to attaining the city of nirvana.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /

original: thog med pa'i /
analyzed: thog med pa'i /
translated: It has an beginningless

analyzed: rtsa ba nyid nas bcom par bya'o //

analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to /

analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /

original: bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu gcig pa /

analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du kho bo cag ni de 'dra ba'i rigs pas grol ba la /
translated: As for what was said, we are liberated by reasoning like that.

analyzed: dper na / de phyir de rgyu la gnod med //

analyzed: cho ga de la ji ltar gnod ces bya ba lta bu nges par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gang zhig dbang dang ldan pa de ni rab tu skye ba 'byung ba rgyun chad pa can yin te /

analyzed: de la 'brel ba med pas the tshom za bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: sa bon la sogs pa la mi skye ba'i rgyu dbang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can mthong ba 'di yang nus med yin gang la zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa la mi skye ba'i rgyu dbang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can mthong ba 'di yang nus med yin gang la zhe na /
translated: Because it follows that one would be liberated even though one has not abandoned the obscurations.

original: skyes bu mi skye ba la sa bon la sogs pa la nus pa mthong ba de ltar skyes bu'i yang srid pa med pa yang nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu mi skye ba la sa bon la sogs pa la nus pa mthong ba de ltar skyes bu'i yang srid pa med pa yang nus pa med pa yin no //

analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa'i til mar gyis bskus pa dang / bsregs pa dang / phye mar @111a * //

analyzed: byas pa dang / btsos pa dang btags pa la sogs pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /

analyzed: 'o na 'dir yang til mar gyis bskus pa la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong ba las skyes bu rnams grol bar 'dod par 'gyur na de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But in this case, the power of anointing with sesame oil, etc. is seen, and it is maintained that persons are liberated from that. But that is not maintained.

original: de ltar na dbang las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not liberation from the power of karma.

original: skyes bu sngar sdig pa byed pa can las bla mas sdig pa blangs nas /
analyzed: skyes bu sngar sdig pa byed pa can las bla mas sdig pa blangs nas /
translated: The guru takes the sin of a person who previously committed sin,

original: sbyin sreg gis de rnam par bcom pa na /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gis de rnam par bcom pa na /
translated: and when he burns it up in the fire sacrifice,

analyzed: skyes bu de phyis srang dang bsgar ba na snga ma'i gnas skabs las yang bar 'gyur ba des na 'di'i sdig pa zad ba yin pa de'i phyir sdig pa zad pas grol ba yin par rtogs par bya'o zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de yang nges pa nyid

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

original: de ltar na skyes bu 'di'i lci ba nyid med kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu 'di'i lci ba nyid med kyi /

original: cho ga 'dis sdig pa bcom pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang las yin gzhan yang lci ba nyid ni sa dang chu'i chos nyid yin gyi sdig pa'i chos ma yin pa de bas na sdig lci min /

analyzed: sdig pa yang lus can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: But if something is not physical, it is not heavy.üîΩBut

original: gzhan yang dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi cho ga yang srid bar byed pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par gags byed pa med pa yin pa de ltar na skye ba gzhan cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / 'di las sman gnas 'gro ba skye ba ni /
translated: What is it?üîΩIt is said that birth is the going to the place of the six sense spheres and the arising of that which occurs together with them.

original: skye mched drug dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba mnga' ba la sogs pa'i gnas su nye bar 'gro bar skye ba yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye mched drug dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba mnga' ba la sogs pa'i gnas su nye bar 'gro bar skye ba yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And that is explained as follows:

original: de yang / log shes dang ni de las 'byung //
analyzed: de yang / log shes dang ni de las 'byung //
translated: From wrong knowledge and from that,

original: sred dang sems pa'i dbang dag gis //
analyzed: sred dang sems pa'i dbang dag gis //
translated: From craving and intention,

original: sdug bsngal la phyin ci log pa'i blo dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang log pa'i shes pa de las 'byung ba'i srid pa'i 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa de dag ni skye ba'i @111b rgyu yin no zhes de yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la phyin ci log pa'i blo dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang log pa'i shes pa de las 'byung ba'i srid pa'i 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa de dag ni skye ba'i @111b rgyu yin no zhes de yang bstan zin to //
translated: From the mind that is mistaken about suffering and from the wrong knowledge that is concomitant with it, craving that arises from that and intention that is concomitant with the desire for existence are the causes of birth.

original: de phyir de bcad skye mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de phyir de bcad skye mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, when that is cut off, it does not arise.

original: de gcod par byed pas na de bcad pa ste //
analyzed: de gcod par byed pas na de bcad pa ste //
translated: The cutting off of that is the cutting off of that.

original: skyes bu'o // srid dang phyin ci log gi blo de dag med pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'o // srid dang phyin ci log gi blo de dag med pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The person. The non-existence of that craving and the erroneous mind is the non-acceptance of the inferior state.

original: gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur pa de ni de tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur pa de ni de tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: That which exists when something exists and does not exist when it does not exist has the nature of arising from that alone.

original: sred pa dang phyin ci log pa'i blo dang mtshungs par lhan cig sems pa dag yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can skye ba yin ba de ltar na /
analyzed: sred pa dang phyin ci log pa'i blo dang mtshungs par lhan cig sems pa dag yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can skye ba yin ba de ltar na /
translated: Craving and the erroneous mind arise in association with the mind, and they exist when it exists and do not exist when it does not exist. Thus,

original: de tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: de tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: they have the nature of arising from that alone.

original: de tsam las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de tsam las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they arise from that alone,

original: skye de dag nus nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye de dag nus nyid yin no //
translated: they are only its power.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sems pa dag go //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sems pa dag go //
translated: The intentions explained above.

original: de yang sdar rab tu bsgrubs zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sdar rab tu bsgrubs zin pa yin no //
translated: And that has already been fully established.

original: gal te skye ba'i rgyu sngon byas pa'i las kyang yod pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i rgyu sngon byas pa'i las kyang yod pa ma yin nam //
translated: But isn‚Äôt there also a cause of birth, namely, karma that was previously performed?

original: ji ltar na de de tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de de tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be that it is the nature of that to arise from just that?

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'das pa'i las cung zad tsam yang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las snga ma snga ma mngon par 'dus byas pa las phyi ma phyi ma phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ji srid ji skad
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'das pa'i las cung zad tsam yang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las snga ma snga ma mngon par 'dus byas pa las phyi ma phyi ma phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ji srid ji skad
translated: There is not the slightest bit of past karma that is other than that, but rather, because of the prior performance of karma that is characterized by intention, the subsequent karma is superior.

original: du bshad pa'i sems pa de dag rang nyid las tha ma'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: du bshad pa'i sems pa de dag rang nyid las tha ma'i nus pa'o //
translated: As long as there is the nature of karma that is characterized by intention, it is the nature of that to arise from just that.

original: sngon gyi yang de dag rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi yang de dag rgyu yin no //
translated: The prior karma is the cause of that.

original: de 'dra ba'i las ni dbang dang ldan pa yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i las ni dbang dang ldan pa yang yod pa yin no //
translated: There is also karma that is powerful.

original: yin phyir tshang ba skye rgyu yin //
analyzed: yin phyir tshang ba skye rgyu yin //
translated: Because of that, it is the cause of birth.

original: yang skye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang skye ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is also birth itself.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la rgyu tshang ba gang yod pa de ni de las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la rgyu tshang ba gang yod pa de ni de las byung ba yin te /
translated: Whatever is complete in terms of cause is the cause of that.

original: dper na skyes bu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu tshang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu tshang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the eye consciousness of a person whose causes of eye consciousness are complete.

original: skyes bu dbang dang ldan pa la yang log ba'i shes pa dang de las byung ba'i sred pa'i sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi skye ba'i rgyu tshang ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dbang dang ldan pa la yang log ba'i shes pa dang de las byung ba'i sred pa'i sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi skye ba'i rgyu tshang ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And for a person who has the faculties, there is the cause complete for the arising characterized by the craving and the volition that arise from wrong knowledge. This is a natural inference.

original: 'gro dang rtogs pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'gro dang rtogs pa'i ste /
translated: The going and the understanding,

original: gnas las gnas gzhan du phyin pa dang khong du chud pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnas las gnas gzhan du phyin pa dang khong du chud pa'i'o //
translated: the going from one place to another place and the understanding,

original: byed pa ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: the agent is the eye, etc.

original: ci rigs par rten yin te rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par rten yin te rgyu yin no //
translated: The support is the cause, as is appropriate.

original: rtogs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su phyin pa sgrub par byed pa de dag chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ba las @112a * //üîΩ'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su phyin pa sgrub par byed pa de dag chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ba las @112a * // 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The establishment of the going to the place that is understood and desired is from the non-seeing of the characteristics of virtue and non-virtue.

original: ma mthong ba dbang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: ma mthong ba dbang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: The cause of the destruction of the collection characterized by the faculties, etc., is the non-seeing.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs par 'gro ba dang rtogs pa'i rten yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs par 'gro ba dang rtogs pa'i rten yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The collection of causes and effects does not exist as a basis for going and understanding.

original: de bas na dbang dang ldan pa ni dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dbang dang ldan pa ni dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the powerful one does not go to a lower realm.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa nyi shu'i 'jug pas skyed pa'i 'du byed yin te ma mthong ba yin gyi khyed cag gis bstan pa'i sems pa min de ltar gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa nyi shu'i 'jug pas skyed pa'i 'du byed yin te ma mthong ba yin gyi khyed cag gis bstan pa'i sems pa min de ltar gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: That is the formation produced by the engagement of the twenty kinds of virtue and nonvirtue. It is not seen, but it is not the intention that you teach. Thus, the reason is not established.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu yod pa ma yin pa de ni de yir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu yod pa ma yin pa de ni de yir mi 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever does not exist as the cause of something is not that of that.

original: dper na mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i skyes bu'i mig gi rnam par shes par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i skyes bu'i mig gi rnam par shes par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the eye of a person does not become the eye consciousness, because the cause of eye consciousness does not exist for the eye.

original: skyes bu'i dbang la yang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pas skyed pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang la yang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pas skyed pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Also, the cause of the collection of effects and actions produced by the powerful one is not seen to exist. This is the nonobservation of the cause.

original: gang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba can de ni 'gro ba dang rtogs pa byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba can de ni 'gro ba dang rtogs pa byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is devoid of the collection of effect and activity does not perform going and understanding,

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: like space.

original: skyes bu dbang bskur ba shi ba yang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tu sogs pa dang bral ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dbang bskur ba shi ba yang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tu sogs pa dang bral ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The person who has been consecrated and has died is devoid of the collection of effect and activity. This is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: yul gzhan las mngon par 'dod pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byed pa skyed phyir skye ba yongs su len pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir //
analyzed: yul gzhan las mngon par 'dod pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byed pa skyed phyir skye ba yongs su len pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir //
translated: Because it generates the activity that has the characteristic of going from one place to a desired place, it is the nature of taking rebirth.

original: yod med kyi rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yod med kyi rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: It follows existence and nonexistence.

original: 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa 'dod pa'i yul thob pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa 'dod pa'i yul thob pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The attainment of the desired place, which is the collection of effect and activity, follows existence and nonexistence. This is the meaning.

original: gang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: What follows existence and nonexistence?

original: log pa'i shes pa dang / sred pa'i sems pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i blo'i'o //üîΩde bas na 'bras bu dang byed pa kun nas thob pa'i phyir blo'i nus pa /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa dang / sred pa'i sems pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i blo'i'o // de bas na 'bras bu dang byed pa kun nas thob pa'i phyir blo'i nus pa /
translated: and the mind associated with the volition of craving.

original: mthong ba yin gyi gzhan du min /
analyzed: mthong ba yin gyi gzhan du min /
translated: Therefore, the power of the mind is seen to be the cause of the attainment of all results and actions, and not anything else.

original: dge ba la sogs pa 'jug pas bskyed pas 'du byed ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa 'jug pas bskyed pas 'du byed ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not a creator because it is generated by the instigation of virtue, etc.

original: de dbang gi blo yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de yod /
analyzed: de dbang gi blo yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de yod /
translated: The mind is present or absent in accordance with the presence or absence of the power of the mind.

original: de dag cis mi 'gro //
analyzed: de dag cis mi 'gro //
translated: Why don‚Äôt they go?

original: byed pa rnams skye ba'i yul du ci'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed /
analyzed: byed pa rnams skye ba'i yul du ci'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed /
translated: Why don‚Äôt the creators go to the place where they are to be born?

original: 'gro ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: They do go, the author thinks.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs @112b ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs @112b ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason given by the opponent is not established.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur ba de ni de las 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur ba de ni de las 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The application of the reason is this: Whatever exists when something exists and does not exist when it does not exist is the cause of that,

original: dper na mig yod pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig yod pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as visual consciousness exists when the eye exists and does not exist when it does not exist.

original: skyes bu dang por skyes pa 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa la yang log pa'i shes pa dang / de las byung ba'i sred pa'i sems pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems yod na khyad par can gyi gnas su 'gro ba thob pa la sogs par 'gyur zhing /

translated: The first person who is born has a consciousness that is mistaken with regard to the collection of effects and agents, and if he has a mind concomitant with the intention of craving that arises from that, he will obtain the state of going to a special place and so on.üîΩIf he does not have that, he will not be like the son of a barren woman.

translated: This may be so, but

analyzed: du bshad pa'i 'bras bu 'gyur ba ma yin te /

analyzed: 'bras bu dang byed bdag gi skye ba thob pa'i phyir gzhan la yang ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dependent on another for the attainment of the result and the activity of the self.

original: sa bon yod na myu gur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sa bon nyid myu gu skyed par byed pa'i skyed par byed pa de ni gzhan la yang ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sa bon nyid myu gu skyed par byed pa'i skyed par byed pa de ni gzhan la yang ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the seed exists, the sprout will come into existence. The seed itself is the producer of the sprout, and that producer is dependent on another.

original: de ltar blo yang dbang bskur gyis yang sred pa skyed pa'i nus pa ma bcom pa can bdag gi yon tan la sogs pa'i khyad par la ltos nas 'bras bu byed pa'i dang tshul can yin no //

analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang bskur gyis bdag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bcom pa de'i tshe /

translated: then it is powerless. Therefore, it is pure.üîΩIf the mind is powerless to project the activityüîΩor to attain the desired state,

analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas thob bar byed pa la nus pa med pa de ltar na ni /

analyzed: nus med dbang la sogs de ma thag tu /

analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni grol bar bya ba'i phyir sngags kyis 'dus byas pa 'ga' zhig 'ded pa gang yin pa bzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to those who are powerless, such as those who are bound by the power of mantras, etc.

analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu'o //
translated: Immediately after these,

original: 'dzin 'phen 'khrug dang 'gog pa dang // sems pas 'gyur gyi dbang gis min //
analyzed: 'dzin 'phen 'khrug dang 'gog pa dang // sems pas 'gyur gyi dbang gis min //
translated: The mind is turned back by the power of the causes, not by the power of the object.üîΩThe causes are four: apprehension, projection, agitation, and cessation.

analyzed: rang gi yul la 'jug pa las bzlog pa med pa'i 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: 'gog pa ni blo'i rjes su mthun pa yod na yang 'khrug pa ldog pa yin no //

analyzed: de dag sems kyi dbang gis te sems dang rjes su 'brel pas byed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa'i phyir dbang bskur pa dag gis dbang bskur ba'i blo las mi 'gyur na /

analyzed: dbang bskur ba rnams dbang bskur bas rang bzhin la gnod pa byed pa med par yang blo las 'gyur ba de ltar na /

analyzed: dper na nas kyi sa bon med pa na yang s'a lu'i sa bon yod na s'a lu'i myu gu 'byung ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: de dang rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bshad pa 'ba' zhig gi tshe /

analyzed: rang gi phyogs log pa'i shes pa dang sred pa la sogs pa'i 'phel ba na 'phel bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: des na bdag med pa mthong ba nyid de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs yin zhing rang gi phyogs ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the vision of selflessness is the antidote to those defilements, and one‚Äôs own position is the cause.

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba de ni de'i gnyen po'i phyogs can dang de'i rgyu can yin te /

original: dper na chu 'phel ba dang / bud shing sngon du song ba can gyi me'i khyad par 'phel ba na me phul du byung ba dang 'grib brjes su thob pa na de ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs @114a * //üîΩcan dang de'i rgyu can yin pa lta bu'o //

translated: When the fire decreases, it is the opposite of that and its cause.

original: lag pa'i shes pa la sogs phyir 'byung ba dag kyang bdag kyang bdag med pa mthong ba dang / log pa'i shes pa dang sred pa'i sems pa sngar gyi 'phel ba na phul du byung ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //

translated: Because the rites of consecration, etc., are not harmful to the causes of false knowledge, craving, and suffering, they are not destroyed. And because the vision of selflessness is harmful,
