translated: are the cause of the craving for pleasure, etc., because of ignorance.

original: 'dis ni lam la phyin ci log pa'i ma rig pa bstan cing /
analyzed: 'dis ni lam la phyin ci log pa'i ma rig pa bstan cing /
translated: This shows the ignorance that is the perversion with regard to the path.

original: de las byung ba dang de'i rang bzhin gyi sred pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa bstan to //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir lam ma rig pa dang 'gal bar gyur pa na sred pa dang yang don gyis 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de las byung ba dang de'i rang bzhin gyi sred pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa bstan to // de nyid kyi phyir lam ma rig pa dang 'gal bar gyur pa na sred pa dang yang don gyis 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It shows that craving, which arises from that and has the nature of that, is the cause of suffering.üîΩTherefore, when the path is in opposition to ignorance, it is also in opposition to craving, in the sense of the latter being the cause of suffering.

original: de nyid la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma rig pas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu dmigs pa nyid kyi lam gnyen po'i phyogs nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma rig pas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu dmigs pa nyid kyi lam gnyen po'i phyogs nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThat very path is the antidote‚Äù shows that the path is the antidote because it is the object that is perceived in a way that is the opposite of the way in which the aspects of the unreal are superimposed by ignorance.

original: bden pa bzhi po //üîΩde nyid la ni de 'gal don //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po // de nyid la ni de 'gal don //
translated: The four noble truthsüîΩare the object that is the opposite of that.

original: de nyid rnam pa rjes rtogs can //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa rjes rtogs can //
translated: It is the path that has the aspects of that reality.

original: don yang dag pa'i rnam pa ni don gyi de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don yang dag pa'i rnam pa ni don gyi de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the real object is the aspect of the reality of the object, such as impermanence.

original: de dag dang 'gal ba ni ma rig pas bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sgro btags pa gang yin pa de rnams dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang 'gal ba ni ma rig pas bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sgro btags pa gang yin pa de rnams dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: It is incompatible with those, because it is incompatible with the superimpositions taught by ignorance, etc.

original: de'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin dang phyin ci log pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin dang phyin ci log pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the nature of that aspect and the nature of the opposite, is the meaning.

original: rnam pa de rjes su rtogs shing khong du chud la shes pa'i dang tshul can gang la yod pa de ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag lta ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de rjes su rtogs shing khong du chud la shes pa'i dang tshul can gang la yod pa de ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag lta ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of realizing and comprehending that aspect and the mode of knowing it is called the right view that has the characteristic of seeing selflessness.

original: 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin las phyin ci log pa yin pa'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs su sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin las phyin ci log pa yin pa'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs su sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This is applied to the side of the antidote because it is the opposite of the nature of the cause of suffering.

original: gang gi phyir 'di gnyen po'i phyogs yin gyi dbang bskur la sogs pa'i chog ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di nyid /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di gnyen po'i phyogs yin gyi dbang bskur la sogs pa'i chog ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di nyid /
translated: Because this is the antidote, not the rite of consecration, etc., therefore this is the antidote.

original: legs bsgoms yang dag lta ba yis //
analyzed: legs bsgoms yang dag lta ba yis //
translated: By the correct view, well cultivated,

original: gang gi tshe yang dag par bsgoms pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag par bsgoms pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is well cultivated, it becomes its nature.

original: sred pa'i rjes 'brang bcas 'joms byed //
analyzed: sred pa'i rjes 'brang bcas 'joms byed //
translated: Then it destroys craving, along with its following.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa ser sna dang phrag dog la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa ser sna dang phrag dog la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Along with the faults of stinginess, envy, etc., which are the cause of suffering.

original: rgyu gsum can skye ba'i mchan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gang la las dang nyon mongs pa dang / lus de rgyu gsum yod pa de ni rgyu gsum can no //
analyzed: rgyu gsum can skye ba'i mchan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gang la las dang nyon mongs pa dang / lus de rgyu gsum yod pa de ni rgyu gsum can no //
translated: The suffering which has the characteristic of arising, having three causes, is that which has three causes.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yod na /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yod na /
translated: When there is the abandonment of the defilements, such as attachment to the views of self and mine,

original: skye bdag ni mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: skye bdag ni mi 'byung ste //
translated: then the arising of the self does not occur.

original: zhes @116b bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes @116b bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is to be supplied.

original: yang snga na med pa'i skye ba 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang snga na med pa'i skye ba 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The arising of the non-existent before does not occur. This is the meaning.

original: las dang lus dang gnas na yang /
analyzed: las dang lus dang gnas na yang /
translated: And also, in the case of karma, body, and place,

original: rgyu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa lhag ma yod na yang gcig med phyir na /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa lhag ma yod na yang gcig med phyir na /
translated: if the remaining causes are present, but one is absent,

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu gcig med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs ba can dag gi rgyu ma chang ba yod na yang srid pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu gcig med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs ba can dag gi rgyu ma chang ba yod na yang srid pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: then existence does not occur, because one cause, which is the characteristic of the defilements, is absent.

original: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sa bon med par myu gu bzhin /
analyzed: sa bon med par myu gu bzhin /
translated: Like a sprout without a seed.

original: dper na sa la sogs pa'i rgyu lhag ma yod du zin kyang sa bon gcig ma tshang ba'i phyir myu gu mi skye ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sa la sogs pa'i rgyu lhag ma yod du zin kyang sa bon gcig ma tshang ba'i phyir myu gu mi skye ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, even though the remaining causes, such as the soil, are present, a sprout does not arise because one cause, the seed, is absent.

original: sbyor ba ni gang rgyu ma tshang ba can de ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang rgyu ma tshang ba can de ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: That which is incomplete as to its causes does not arise,

original: dper na rgyu ma tshang ba can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu ma tshang ba can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a sprout, for example, which is incomplete as to its causes.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa la sogs pa spangs pa can gyi yang srid par rgyu ma tshang ba can no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa la sogs pa spangs pa can gyi yang srid par rgyu ma tshang ba can no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the reason is that the cause of rebirth is incomplete for one who has abandoned attachment and so on that view the self and entities connected to the self.

original: 'o na gal te gang gi tshe las dang lus dag kyang rgyu nyid yin na gcig med na yang mi skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gang gi tshe las dang lus dag kyang rgyu nyid yin na gcig med na yang mi skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: If karma and the body are the cause of rebirth, then if either is absent, rebirth will not occur.

original: 'di dag zad pa las kyang grol bar brjod pa gang yin pa de dag rigs pa nyid smra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag zad pa las kyang grol bar brjod pa gang yin pa de dag rigs pa nyid smra ba yin no zhe na /
translated: So why do you say that liberation is due to the exhaustion of karma and the body?

original: de ni las dang lus dag spangs min te /
analyzed: de ni las dang lus dag spangs min te /
translated: Karma and the body are not abandonedüîΩbecause they are not abandoned by the power of reason.

original: nus pa'am rigs pas spong bar byed pa ma yin na gang gis na de dag spangs pas yang srid par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nus pa'am rigs pas spong bar byed pa ma yin na gang gis na de dag spangs pas yang srid par mi 'gyur /
translated: If they are not abandoned, how can rebirth not occur due to their exhaustion?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir dang // rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can 'di spong bar 'dod pa gang yin pa des ni de gal te gnyen po'i phyogs shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa'i 'bad rtsol byed na /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir dang // rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can 'di spong bar 'dod pa gang yin pa des ni de gal te gnyen po'i phyogs shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa'i 'bad rtsol byed na /
translated: If one wishes to abandon this conceptual thought, then if one understands the antidote to it, one should strive to cultivate its antidote in order to abandon it.

original: rtog pa po 'di las dang lus kyi gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa'i tshad mas rtogs par nus pa ma yin na gang gis na las la sogs pa zad pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur te de ltar na /
analyzed: rtog pa po 'di las dang lus kyi gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa'i tshad mas rtogs par nus pa ma yin na gang gis na las la sogs pa zad pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur te de ltar na /
translated: But if one cannot ascertain the antidote to karma and so on through the measure of cultivating the antidote to conceptual thought, then by what means will one engage in the elimination of karma and so on?üîΩBecause there is no antidote

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba kho nas dbyung bar bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba kho nas dbyung bar bya ba yin pas na /
translated: This is because it is impossible to understand it.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po'i phyogs bkag pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po'i phyogs bkag pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the antidote is not realized. This is taught in order to show that it is not possible. It is not that the antidote is completely rejected.

original: de ltar na @117a * //
analyzed: de ltar na @117a * //
translated: Thus,

original: lung las grub pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang de dad pa tsam gyis rtog pa nyid kyis nges pa med pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: lung las grub pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang de dad pa tsam gyis rtog pa nyid kyis nges pa med pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: even when the antidote is established by scripture, it is still uncertain, because it is only imagined by faith.

original: nges pa med pa la yang rtog pa dang ldan pa nan tan du byed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nges pa med pa la yang rtog pa dang ldan pa nan tan du byed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: And if it is uncertain, one who has understanding will not make effort.

original: de na na tan du byed na ni rtog pas sngon du gtong pa can nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na na tan du byed na ni rtog pas sngon du gtong pa can nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one does make effort, then it will not be preceded by understanding.

original: de bas na gnyen po'i phyogs nges pa med pa can ni de la 'jug par mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyen po'i phyogs nges pa med pa can ni de la 'jug par mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to engage in that which has an uncertain antidote.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin yang de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin yang de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can yin pa de ni /
translated: As for application, even if it is preceded by understanding, one who does not know its nature

original: don de rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don de rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to understand that meaning.

original: dper na dug ma yin pa nyid du ma rtogs par zas za ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dug ma yin pa nyid du ma rtogs par zas za ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like eating food without understanding that it is not poison.

original: skyes bu rtogs par 'dod pa 'di yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin yang las zad par byed pa'i lam mi shes pa can no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed ba 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu rtogs par 'dod pa 'di yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin yang las zad par byed pa'i lam mi shes pa can no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed ba 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This person who wishes to understand is one who puts thought first, but is one who does not know the path that exhausts karma. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: nus med phyir ro //
analyzed: nus med phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible.

original: las dang lus dag spang bar mi nus pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir de spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol mi bya'o //
analyzed: las dang lus dag spang bar mi nus pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir de spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol mi bya'o //
translated: Because the cause of abandoning karma and the body is not possible, one should not strive to abandon them.

original: ji ltar mi nus pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi nus pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not possible?

original: ji srid du las dang lus dag gis rgyu sred pa yod pa de ji srid du ma tshang pa med pa'i sred pa ni /
analyzed: ji srid du las dang lus dag gis rgyu sred pa yod pa de ji srid du ma tshang pa med pa'i sred pa ni /
translated: As long as there is craving, the cause of karma and the body, as long as there is no incompleteness,

original: yod na yang las rnams 'byung zhing las las kyang skye ba yin na /
analyzed: yod na yang las rnams 'byung zhing las las kyang skye ba yin na /
translated: craving exists, and karma arises from that, and birth arises from karma.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: las dang lus dag 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang lus dag 'byung phyir ro //
translated: because karma and the body arise.

original: rgyu'i phyir las dang lus dag spong bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir las dang lus dag spong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of the cause, one cannot abandon karma and the body.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig spong bar nus pa ma yin pa de ni spang ba'i phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis 'bad rtsol bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig spong bar nus pa ma yin pa de ni spang ba'i phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis 'bad rtsol bya ba ma yin te /
translated: As for the application, one who cannot abandon something should not make an effort to imagine that he can abandon it.

original: dper na lus can shes rab dang ldan pas nam mkha' spong ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol mi byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus can shes rab dang ldan pas nam mkha' spong ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol mi byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a wise person does not make an effort to abandon space.üîΩEven a person who has wrong knowledge and craving cannot abandon karma and the body.

original: log pa'i shes pa dang sred pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bus kyang las dang lus spong bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa dang sred pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bus kyang las dang lus spong bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur mod kyi gang gi tshe sred pa dang las gnyi ga zad par byas pa de'i tshe yang las sam skye ba ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur mod kyi gang gi tshe sred pa dang las gnyi ga zad par byas pa de'i tshe yang las sam skye ba ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Even if one does not do that, when both craving and karma are exhausted, then karma and birth do not occur.

original: gnyi ga zad par byed pa'i 'bad rtsol byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga zad par byed pa'i 'bad rtsol byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, one should make an effort to exhaust both.

original: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that is so,

original: gnyis zad don du sred pa dang las zad pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'bad na yang ste /
analyzed: gnyis zad don du sred pa dang las zad pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'bad na yang ste /
translated: Even if one strives to eliminate the two, craving and karma, as the cause of exhaustion,üîΩ

original: 'bad pa byed na yang las zad dub pa gang @117b yin pa de /
analyzed: 'bad pa byed na yang las zad dub pa gang @117b yin pa de /
translated: Even if one strives to exhaust karma and craving, the cause of exhaustion,

original: don med yin /
analyzed: don med yin /
translated: any exhaustion of karma is pointless.

original: de ltar na re zhig las kyi gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs par mi nus pa dang / sred pa yod na de nus pa med pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig las kyi gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs par mi nus pa dang / sred pa yod na de nus pa med pa bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that, for the time being, one is unable to realize the antidote to karma, and that if craving exists, one is unable to do so.

original: srid pa spang bar byas na yang de yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la lhan cig byed pa zad pa'i phyir nus pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa spang bar byas na yang de yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la lhan cig byed pa zad pa'i phyir nus pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if one abandons existence, since the cooperative cause for linking with existence is exhausted, one is unable to do so. Thus, one does not link with existence.

original: de tsam nyid kyis skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs ba nyid yin pa'i phyir las zad pa'i dub pa 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam nyid kyis skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs ba nyid yin pa'i phyir las zad pa'i dub pa 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: Since the purpose of a person is completely fulfilled by just that, the exhaustion of karma is pointless.

original: de ltar na re zhig gnyen po'i phyogs shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dang / las zad par nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir las dang lus dag las grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gnyen po'i phyogs shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dang / las zad par nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir las dang lus dag las grol ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the side of the antidote is not able to know the afflictions, and since karma is not able to be exhausted, one is not liberated from karma and the body.

original: 'ba' zhig kyang lus gdung bas sngon byas pa'i las longs spyod pa las de zad pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa'i phyir grol ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang lus gdung bas sngon byas pa'i las longs spyod pa las de zad pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa'i phyir grol ba yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that one is liberated from karma and the body because the karma previously created by tormenting the body is exhausted and future karma is not created,

original: de'i las kyi 'bras bu longs spyod pas kyang de dag gi las rnams zad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i las kyi 'bras bu longs spyod pas kyang de dag gi las rnams zad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then to demonstrate that it is illogical that karma is exhausted through experiencing the results of karma,üîΩit is said:

original: 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because various results are seen.

original: de la 'dir kha cig ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir kha cig ni /
translated: In this regard, some say,

original: gdung ba rtsom pa las mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba ni las kyi 'bras bu ma yin na /
analyzed: gdung ba rtsom pa las mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba ni las kyi 'bras bu ma yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the experience of undesirable results from the creation of torment is not the result of karma,

original: gang las de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pas las zad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang las de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pas las zad pa yin te /
translated: then through the experience of the result of that karma, karma is exhausted.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rjod par byed na de dang de'i 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rjod par byed na de dang de'i 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de ltar na las de 'dra ba de ni stobs dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na las de 'dra ba de ni stobs dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, that kind of action is not powerful.

original: gang gis na 'di'i 'bras bu skyes bu byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di'i 'bras bu skyes bu byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yin /
translated: How could its effect depend on the cooperation of a human agent?

original: de lta ma yin na skyes bu'i byed pas bsgrubs pa'i rgyal srid la sogs pa la'ang las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skyes bu'i byed pas bsgrubs pa'i rgyal srid la sogs pa la'ang las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, even a kingdom, etc., which is accomplished by human effort, would not be the effect of action.

original: 'dod pa de dag kyang dor bar nus pa yin zhing 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag kyang dor bar nus pa yin zhing 'dod pa yang yin no //
translated: And those desires can be abandoned.

original: de bas na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa cung zad gang yin pa de thams cad las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa cung zad gang yin pa de thams cad las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the fact that whatever is desired or not desired is the effect of action.

original: de skad du 'phags pa gnas bstan pas /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa gnas bstan pas /
translated: Thus it is said in the ƒÄryade≈õanƒÅparivarta:

original: bde 'gro 'am ni ngan 'gro yang //
analyzed: bde 'gro 'am ni ngan 'gro yang //
translated: ‚ÄúWhether it is a good destiny or a bad destiny,

original: skye mchad lnga yi rkyen can gyi //
analyzed: skye mchad lnga yi rkyen can gyi //
translated: it is conditioned by the five aggregates.

original: sems ni mi 'dod skye gang de //üîΩsdig pa'i las kyi @118a * //
analyzed: sems ni mi 'dod skye gang de // sdig pa'i las kyi @118a * //
translated: The mind is not desired, but arises.

original: 'bras bur 'dod //
analyzed: 'bras bur 'dod //
translated: It is asserted to be the result of sinful karma.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Thus, the arising of desire is the result of merit.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this reason is indefinite.

original: longs spyod chen po dang / nad dang nad med pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa ma tshang ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa snang bas na 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang / nad dang nad med pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa ma tshang ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa snang bas na 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Since various results such as great wealth, health, and the absence of missing limbs and digits are seen, due to seeing various results,

original: las rnams kyi nus pa'i khyad par ngo bo du ma can gyi 'bras bu phyin pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog /'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin par nus pa can gyi las de dag gis 'bras bu sna tshogs pa nyams su myong ba /
analyzed: las rnams kyi nus pa'i khyad par ngo bo du ma can gyi 'bras bu phyin pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog /'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin par nus pa can gyi las de dag gis 'bras bu sna tshogs pa nyams su myong ba /
translated: the specific potency of karmas is inferred to be the potency to produce a result with multiple natures. Those karmas that have the potency to produce various results experience various results.

original: de phyir gdung ba'i nyon mongs gcig / rang bzhin las ni yongs su gdung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yongs su gdung ba'i 'bras bu las 'bras bu 'byin po'i sgo nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can gyi /üîΩlas zad min te rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyir gdung ba'i nyon mongs gcig / rang bzhin las ni yongs su gdung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yongs su gdung ba'i 'bras bu las 'bras bu 'byin po'i sgo nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can gyi / las zad min te rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the affliction of torment is not the result of karma, because it is not tenable that the result of karma is a single affliction of torment.üîΩThe result of karma is not exhausted, because it is not tenable that the result of karma is a single affliction of torment.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can yin pa de ni 'bras bu ngo bo gcig pa can 'byin par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can yin pa de ni 'bras bu ngo bo gcig pa can 'byin par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that karma, which has a variety of results, is able to produce a single result, because it is not tenable that karma, which has a variety of results, is able to produce a single result.

original: dper na nas dang s'a lu dang ko tra ba'i sa bon lta bu'o //üîΩlas kyang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nas dang s'a lu dang ko tra ba'i sa bon lta bu'o // las kyang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: For example, barley, rice, and ko·π≠rava seeds.üîΩThe pervasion is that which is able to produce a variety of results is not able to produce a single result.üîΩThe contradictory observation is that karma has a variety of results.

original: gang zhig 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin par nus pa can yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig gi blo nas 'bras bu 'byin pas nus pa zad pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin par nus pa can yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig gi blo nas 'bras bu 'byin pas nus pa zad pa can ma yin te /
translated: That which is able to produce a variety of results does not exhaust its ability to produce results by producing a single result.

original: dper na nas dang s'a lu dang ko tra ba'i sa bon de dag ni ko tra ba'i myu gu skyed pas gzhan dag 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa zad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nas dang s'a lu dang ko tra ba'i sa bon de dag ni ko tra ba'i myu gu skyed pas gzhan dag 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa zad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, barley, rice, and ko·π≠rava seeds do not exhaust their potency to produce their own effects, such as sprouts of ko·π≠rava.

original: las dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin pa'i nus pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin pa'i nus pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey possess the potency to produce various effects‚Äù is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par yod pa dang med pa dag las 'bras bu'i 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par yod pa dang med pa dag las 'bras bu'i 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If the existence and nonexistence of special cooperating conditions cause the increase and decrease of effects,

original: las ni rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa la rung ba yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩrnam 'gas lhan cig byed pa rgyas ba med na /
analyzed: las ni rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa la rung ba yin pa de'i phyir / rnam 'gas lhan cig byed pa rgyas ba med na /
translated: then karma is suitable to produce a corresponding effect.üîΩTherefore, how could the existence and nonexistence of special cooperating conditions cause the increase and decrease of effects?üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe effect that arises from a cause that is similar to it‚Äù is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de skyed rgyu 'dra ba las 'byung ba can 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de skyed rgyu 'dra ba las 'byung ba can 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: A similar effect arises from a cause that is similar to it.

original: chung 'gyur rigs mi mthun ldan min //
analyzed: chung 'gyur rigs mi mthun ldan min //
translated: A dissimilar effect does not arise from a cause that is dissimilar.

original: las @118b gzhan yod na las gzhan las 'byung ba can rigs tha dad pa can gyi las kyi 'bras bu gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: las @118b gzhan yod na las gzhan las 'byung ba can rigs tha dad pa can gyi las kyi 'bras bu gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: If there is another action, then the effect of an action that has a different nature does not arise from another action that has a different nature.

original: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon las zhing 'dus byas pa la sogs pa ma tshang bas s'a lu nyid 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon las zhing 'dus byas pa la sogs pa ma tshang bas s'a lu nyid 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: For example, a rice seed produces rice, but if the field is deficient in water, etc., the rice will be small.

original: de yang ko tra ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang ko tra ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: And that small rice is not the effect of a kodrava seed, etc.

original: de ltar snga ma nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no //üîΩci ste 'ang dka' thub nus pa yis /üîΩlas nus pa 'dres pa can gyis byas pa yin na 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig nyid kyi sgo nas zad par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩlas kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa de nyid dka' thub kyi nus pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar snga ma nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no // ci ste 'ang dka' thub nus pa yis / las nus pa 'dres pa can gyis byas pa yin na 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig nyid kyi sgo nas zad par 'gyur ba'am / las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa de nyid dka' thub kyi nus pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the former position is established.üîΩBut if the potency of the action is mixed with the potency of austerity, then the effect would be exhausted by means of a single nature.üîΩOr, the potency of the action would be exhausted by the potency of austerity.

original: de de ltar na dka' thub kyi nus pas las rnams kyi nus pa 'dren pa zad pa yis /
analyzed: de de ltar na dka' thub kyi nus pas las rnams kyi nus pa 'dren pa zad pa yis /
translated: If that is so, then the potency of the action would be exhausted by the potency of austerity.

original: rgyur gyur pa dag gis lhag mar gyur pa 'bras bu chung ba can gang yin pa de phyis kyang longs spyod chung ba'i nyon mongs gang las te /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa dag gis lhag mar gyur pa 'bras bu chung ba can gang yin pa de phyis kyang longs spyod chung ba'i nyon mongs gang las te /
translated: Those who have small resources due to the power of their karma will later have small resources due to the power of their affliction.

original: skra 'bal ba la sogs pas skyed pas las de ma lus par nyams par 'gyur bas zad pa de las grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skra 'bal ba la sogs pas skyed pas las de ma lus par nyams par 'gyur bas zad pa de las grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since they generate affliction through such things as pulling out their hair, they are liberated from that karma that has not yet been exhausted.

original: gal te dka' thub kyi nus pas las kyi nus pa zad pa'i phyir las nyams par 'dod pa'i phyogs de la /
analyzed: gal te dka' thub kyi nus pas las kyi nus pa zad pa'i phyir las nyams par 'dod pa'i phyogs de la /
translated: If you assert that karma is exhausted due to the power of austerities,

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa nyon mongs min las te //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa nyon mongs min las te //
translated: then all affliction would be exhausted due to nonaffliction.

original: lus kyi gdung pa nyams su myong ba med par nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi gdung pa nyams su myong ba med par nyams pa yin no //
translated: Afflictions would be exhausted without experiencing the suffering of tormenting the body.

original: de ltar na dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa shin tu mi bzad pa'i las 'bras bu'i nus pa zad par nus pa'i dka' thub gang yin pa de yin na ji ltar na de nyid kyis srab mor byas pas sdug bsngal chung ba can gyi lus kyi gdung
analyzed: de ltar na dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa shin tu mi bzad pa'i las 'bras bu'i nus pa zad par nus pa'i dka' thub gang yin pa de yin na ji ltar na de nyid kyis srab mor byas pas sdug bsngal chung ba can gyi lus kyi gdung
translated: If austerities have the power to exhaust the result of karma, such as the unbearable suffering of the hells, how could they be weakened by austerities?

original: ba nyams su myong ba tsam gyis 'bras bu gsal ba can gyi las kyi nus pa zad pa la nus pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ba nyams su myong ba tsam gyis 'bras bu gsal ba can gyi las kyi nus pa zad pa la nus pa med par 'gyur /
translated: The potency of karma that has the nature of a clear result is not destroyed by the mere experience of the result.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal de yang ma 'gyur ba de ltar na lus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal de yang ma 'gyur ba de ltar na lus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of afflicting the body with austerities in order to destroy that suffering?

original: nus pa 'dres pa'i phyogs la yang las chags pas nyams pa yin /
analyzed: nus pa 'dres pa'i phyogs la yang las chags pas nyams pa yin /
translated: Even in the case of the mixing of potency, the potency of karma is destroyed by the affliction of austerities.

original: ba spu gcig btogs par byas pa la sogs pa'i gdung bas zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba spu gcig btogs par byas pa la sogs pa'i gdung bas zad par 'gyur te /
translated: It is destroyed by the torment of plucking out a single hair and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin that case‚Äù is that it would be meaningless.

original: 'di yang gang gi tshe brngod ce na /
analyzed: 'di yang gang gi tshe brngod ce na /
translated: When is this affliction of the body by austerities done?

original: gal te nus pa de 'dres par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nus pa de 'dres par byed pa'am /
translated: If it is done in order to mix the potency of karma or

original: zad par byed @119a * //üîΩpa'i dka' thub ste /
analyzed: zad par byed @119a * // pa'i dka' thub ste /
translated: to destroy it,

original: skra 'bal ba la sogs pa las skye ba'i nyon mongs las gzhan 'dod par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: skra 'bal ba la sogs pa las skye ba'i nyon mongs las gzhan 'dod par 'gyur na'o //
translated: then it is an austerity that arises from the affliction of plucking out hair and so on.

original: gal te nyon mongs nyid ce na //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs nyid ce na //
translated: If it is done in order to destroy the affliction itself,üîΩthen it is meaningless.

original: lus gdung bar byed pa dka' thub yin pa de'i tshe dka' thub de las 'bras yin /üîΩlas kyi 'bras bu /
analyzed: lus gdung bar byed pa dka' thub yin pa de'i tshe dka' thub de las 'bras yin / las kyi 'bras bu /
translated: Austerity is that which torments the body.

original: 'di las ni nus pa 'dres sogs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las ni nus pa 'dres sogs ma yin no //
translated: The result of action is not a potency, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni zad pa ma yin par bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni zad pa ma yin par bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes non-exhaustion.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig las kyi 'bras bu yin pa de dka' thub ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig las kyi 'bras bu yin pa de dka' thub ma yin pa'am /
translated: The application is this: that which is the result of action is not austerity,

original: de las nus pa 'dres pa'am zad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las nus pa 'dres pa'am zad pa ma yin te /
translated: nor is it a potency, nor is it non-exhaustion.

original: dper na glang gi las kyi 'bras bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na glang gi las kyi 'bras bu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the result of the action of an ox.

original: nyon mongs pa yang las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The fact that defilement is the result of action is the observation of an inconsistency with a pervasion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na sred pa ni las kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na sred pa ni las kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: For it is craving that is the cause of action,

original: de yang lam gyi zad pa na //
analyzed: de yang lam gyi zad pa na //
translated: and that is exhausted by the path.

original: rgyu can las kyang zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu can las kyang zad pa'i phyir //
translated: And action is exhausted because of the exhaustion of its cause.

original: khyed cag kyang las zad par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag kyang las zad par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: You also accept the exhaustion of action.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod pa de ni de'i gnod pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod pa de ni de'i gnod pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: that which is harmful to the cause of something is harmful to that thing.

original: dper na bad kan can gyi nad kyi rgyu la rtsub pa dang dro ba dang yang pa'i rdzas gnod pa can gyi rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bad kan can gyi nad kyi rgyu la rtsub pa dang dro ba dang yang pa'i rdzas gnod pa can gyi rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the cause of the illness of a person with phlegm is a substance that is rough, hot, and light, which is a cause of harm.

original: lam yang las kyi rgyu sred pa la sogs pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lam yang las kyi rgyu sred pa la sogs pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the path is not a cause of harm to craving, etc., which are the cause of karma. This is a natural inference.

original: gang yang skyon rnams 'gog byed pa bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can thabs yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang yang skyon rnams 'gog byed pa bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can thabs yin par 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, the method is accepted as having the characteristic of seeing selflessness, which stops faults.

original: skyon rnams kyi rgyu sred pa 'joms par byed cing sred pa med na yang ma 'ongs pa'i skyon rnams skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon rnams kyi rgyu sred pa 'joms par byed cing sred pa med na yang ma 'ongs pa'i skyon rnams skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It destroys craving, which is the cause of faults, and when there is no craving, faults that will arise in the future do not arise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye 'dod nyes pa bcom pa'i phyir//
analyzed: skye 'dod nyes pa bcom pa'i phyir//
translated: Because it destroys the faults of desire for rebirth.

original: rgyu'i phyir de dag nyes pa 'gog par byed pa'i thabs yin no //üîΩde skye las la nus 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir de dag nyes pa 'gog par byed pa'i thabs yin no // de skye las la nus 'gyur gyi /
translated: For that reason, it is the method that stops faults.üîΩIt has the power to produce karma that will lead to rebirth.

original: skye bar 'dod pa'i skyon gyis skyed pa'i las la nus par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa'i skyon gyis skyed pa'i las la nus par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It has the power to produce karma that will lead to rebirth, but it does not have the power to produce faults.

original: sngar byas pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar byas pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for what has already been done.

original: ji ltar byas pa bcom par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa bcom par 'gyur //
translated: How can what has already been done be destroyed?

original: sngon byas pa'i las rnams ni zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i las rnams ni zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The karma that has already been done does not perish.

original: de la 'di ltar gal te 'das pa'i las la brten nas brjod pa de'i tshe ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar gal te 'das pa'i las la brten nas brjod pa de'i tshe ma grub pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, if it is said that it is based on past karma, then it is not established.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i las la brten nas ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i las la brten nas ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If it is based on future karma, then what is to be established is established.

original: gal te ji ltar nyon mongs pa yod pa na yang de las las rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir grol ba @119b ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar nyon mongs pa yod pa na yang de las las rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir grol ba @119b ma yin zhing /
translated: If it is said that one is not liberated because karma arises from the afflictions that exist,

original: de bzhin du las kyi gnas pas kyang sred pa dang bral ba rnams kyi nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi gnas pas kyang sred pa dang bral ba rnams kyi nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: in the same way, the state of karma would be the affliction of those who are free from craving.

original: las las skyon ni 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: las las skyon ni 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The fault does not arise from karma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar skyes bu skyon ldan las byed par 'gyur zhing sogs par 'gyur gyi /üîΩbzlog las min te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu skyon ldan las byed par 'gyur zhing sogs par 'gyur gyi / bzlog las min te /
translated: Because a faulty person would do and accumulate karma,üîΩbut not the opposite.

original: skyon dang ldan pa ma yin pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa ma yin pa las ma yin no //
translated: It is not from one who is not faulty.

original: rigs mthun pa'i skyon rnams yod na skyon rnams 'jug par 'gyur gyi bzlog pa las ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i skyon rnams yod na skyon rnams 'jug par 'gyur gyi bzlog pa las ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If faults of the same type exist, faults will occur, but not if they are reversed.

original: sbyor ba ni gang skyon dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni sdig pa'i las mi byed de dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang skyon dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni sdig pa'i las mi byed de dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: The syllogism is: One who is not possessed of faults does not commit sinful actions, like the son of a barren woman.üîΩAnd one who has exhausted faults is not possessed of faults.

original: skyes bu nyes pa zad pa yang skyon dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu nyes pa zad pa yang skyon dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: las 'dod pa las bde ba dang bde ba las 'dod chags pa dang / de bzhin du mi 'dod pa las sdug bsngal nyams su myong zhing de las zhe sdang la sogs pa yin pa de ltar na /

original: dper na ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mkhan po slob ma la ston par byed pa'i tshig gi don slob ma mkhas pa sgrub par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mkhan po slob ma la ston par byed pa'i tshig gi don slob ma mkhas pa sgrub par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a preceptor who possesses the qualities as explained and teaches the disciples the meaning of the words, and the disciples who are skilled in practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das grol @121b par 'dod pa rnams la legs pa dang / bden pa'i don ston par mdzad cing 'chad pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das grol @121b par 'dod pa rnams la legs pa dang / bden pa'i don ston par mdzad cing 'chad pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The Blessed One is one who is intent on teaching and explaining the meaning of what is good and true for those who desire liberation. This is a natural inference.

original: de de ltar na tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba de tsam ni bstod pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba de tsam ni bstod pa'i tshig yin no //

analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig gcig ma gtogs pa lhag ma ni tshad mar sgrub par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: ci'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yon tan mnga' na yang tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba nyid bstod par mdzad pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod ni //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: tshad ma nyid du bstod pa gang yin pa de de'i bstan pa nyid las ni /

analyzed: tshad ma'i de nyid grub don yin //

analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid de bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nyid las grub pa yin no //

original: de ltar kho bo rang nyid kyis brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar kho bo rang nyid kyis brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don to //

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las kyang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las kyang bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: gang rigs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de phan pa 'dod pas bzlog par bya ba yin gyi /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'ga' zhig tu yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes spong ba ma mdzad pa de bas na ma spangs pa'i phyir rigs pa dang ldan pa yin par gzung bar bya ba yin no //

analyzed: 'di yi sbyor ba mthong phyir ro // rjes su dpag pa 'di'i sbyor ba mthong ba'am /

analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das 'di'i rjes su dpag pa mthong ba yin te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su dpag pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: gang de thams cad 'gog chos can skad cig ma can yin no //
translated: Whatever has the nature of arising has the nature of cessation.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa du mar rab tu bstan @122a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //üîΩde skad du gsungs pas na /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa du mar rab tu bstan @122a * // pa'i phyir ro // de skad du gsungs pas na /

analyzed: ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: rtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no // gang 'dir rtags yin no //

analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na / med na mi 'byung mtshan nyid can //
translated: What is the reason here?üîΩThat which has the nature of not occurring when the other is absent.

analyzed: gang la med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yod na zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: gang cung zad 'byung ba'i chos can yin pa de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas /

analyzed: khyab pa ni bstan pa'i rgyu'i phyir //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis med na mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis med na mi 'byung ba //

analyzed: skye ba'i bdag nyid can la sogs pa rang gi bsgrub par bya ba 'gog pa'i chos can nyid la sogs pa dang / med na mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the teaching of the invariable concomitance of the property to be established, such as the nature of being produced, etc., with the reason, such as being an entity, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad cing bstan pa de ltar /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad cing bstan pa de ltar /
translated: The definition and teaching of inference is like this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshad ma'i de kho na nyid du dang por bshad pa yin no //üîΩtshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /

translated: Commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrttika

original: bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: PART TWO

translated: The master has previously set forth the inference of the reason for explaining the treatise on the definition of valid knowledge, and the master has taught the first half of the first verse of homage in the treatise, which is easier to understand, and has completed the explanation of the first half.

analyzed: da tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bshad pa mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the definition of valid knowledge,

analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsams pa yin no //

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: grangs la log par rtogs pa dang / mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa dang / spyod yul la log par rtogs pa dang / 'bras bu la log par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Misconception regarding the number, misconception regarding the definition, misconception regarding the domain, and misconception regarding the result.

original: de la dang por grangs la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩgzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
analyzed: de la dang por grangs la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir / gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
translated: with regard to the number of valid cognitions, he says,

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //

original: 'dis 'jal bar byed pas na tshad ma'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'jal bar byed pas na tshad ma'o //

translated: This refutes the idea that there is one valid cognition or three valid cognitions and so on.

original: 'chad par 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ston par byed pa la /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro // gal te tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ston par byed pa la /
translated: There is not one because it will be explained that inference is a valid cognition.üîΩIf you say that it is pointless to teach the number of valid cognitions when you are teaching the definition of valid cognition,

analyzed: grangs la sogs pa ston pa don med pa yin no zhe na ma yin te de ni mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because it is the meaning of the pure definition.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la ni mi slu ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la ni mi slu ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu 'gyur la /
translated: Direct perception and inference have the same definition, which is nondeceptive.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid mtshon bar bya bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yod pa ma yin na mtshan nyid gcig brjod pa gang gis de dag mtshon par bya ba'i phyir nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid mtshon bar bya bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yod pa ma yin na mtshan nyid gcig brjod pa gang gis de dag mtshon par bya ba'i phyir nus par 'gyur /
translated: When it is to be indicated, then since it does not have a second characteristic, by what expression of a single characteristic could it be indicated?

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid gcig gis mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid gcig gis mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

original: dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan na mtshan nyid dbye ba bstan par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan na mtshan nyid dbye ba bstan par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: when it is taught by way of division, it can be taught by the division of its characteristics.

original: grangs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the number of its characteristics is taught.

original: spyod yul bstan pa yang gang gi tshe yul ma yin pa 'dzin pa tshad mar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de la slu ba yin na de dang 'dra bar rang gi yul la yang de ltar rtogs pa po'i tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba de ltar na
analyzed: spyod yul bstan pa yang gang gi tshe yul ma yin pa 'dzin pa tshad mar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de la slu ba yin na de dang 'dra bar rang gi yul la yang de ltar rtogs pa po'i tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba de ltar na
translated: When the object is taught, if the apprehension of a nonobject were valid cognition, then it would be deceptive. If it were like that, then even with respect to its own object, the one who understands it would not be valid cognition.

original: yul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yul bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the object is taught.

original: gang gi tshe tshad ma las tshad ma'i 'bras bu don gzhan ma yin no zhes ma bstan pa de'i tshe re zhig 'bras bu gdon mi za bar don rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /

translated: When a valid cognition is not taught to be a valid cognition because it is not a different object from its result, then at that time, the result is necessarily the nature of the realization of an object.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be suitable to be a result.

original: de bas na rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of realization is the result.

original: de bas na gang gi tshe rtogs pa'i ngo bo las tha dad pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na gang gi tshe rtogs pa'i ngo bo las tha dad pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when a valid cognition is different from the nature of realization,

original: mi shes pa'i ngo bo der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i ngo bo der 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the nature of non-knowledge.

original: mi shes pa'i ngo bo yang tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir chad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa de ltar na /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i ngo bo yang tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir chad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa de ltar na /
translated: And because the nature of non-knowledge is not suitable to be a valid cognition, the teaching of the result of a valid cognition would be like that.

original: grangs la sogs pa bstan pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa bstan pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of number and so on is not meaningless.

original: de la 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bstan pas tshad ma gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bstan pas tshad ma gcig ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, because inference, which will be explained in the following way, is taught to be a valid cognition, a valid cognition is not singular.

original: de mang po nyid du 'gyur na mang po de nyid de yang yul mang po nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de mang po nyid du 'gyur na mang po de nyid de yang yul mang po nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: If it becomes many, then that many would be many objects.üîΩ

original: yul gcig la yang tshad ma mang po nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig la yang tshad ma mang po nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is many, then that many are the objects, or many valid cognitions operate on one object.

original: re zhig yul mang ba nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig yul mang ba nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: First, it is not because the objects are many.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhal bya gnyis phyir yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis phyir yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Because there are two objects of comprehension, the objects are of two kinds:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩgal te spyi khyad @123a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid do // gal te spyi khyad @123a * //
translated: particulars and universals.

original: par gyi ngo bo gsum pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: par gyi ngo bo gsum pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: If a third, the universal of the particular, exists,

original: dper na autpala sngon po la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩde bas na yul rnam pa gnyis ma yin no zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na autpala sngon po la sogs pa lta bu'o // de bas na yul rnam pa gnyis ma yin no zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: like a blue lotus, for example,üîΩthen the objects are not of two kinds.

original: rnam pa gnyis ma gtogs pa'i gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ma gtogs pa'i gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because apart from the two kinds there is no other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
analyzed: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
translated: Because they are able or unable to perform a function.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gang 'ga' zhig la yang don gyi bya ba byed par nus pa gang yin pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gang 'ga' zhig la yang don gyi bya ba byed par nus pa gang yin pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is able to perform some function for some person is a particular.

original: don byed pa'i nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa'i nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is devoid of all ability to perform a function is a universal.

original: de bas na gal te yul gnyis las tha dad pa nyid du khas blangs pa don gyi bya ba cung zad byed par nus pa de'i tshe yang de rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gal te yul gnyis las tha dad pa nyid du khas blangs pa don gyi bya ba cung zad byed par nus pa de'i tshe yang de rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if a difference from two objects is accepted, and if it is able to perform some function, then it is a particular.

original: ci ste cung zad kyang mi nus pa de'i tshe spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: ci ste cung zad kyang mi nus pa de'i tshe spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i nus pa dang nus pa med pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gcig la rung ba ma yin na /

original: gang gis na ngo bo gnyis pa can gyi yul gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na ngo bo gnyis pa can gyi yul gzhan du 'gyur /

original: de bas na yul gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yul gzhan yod pa ma yin no //

original: 'o na skyes bu mthong ba 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa la skra shad dang sbrang ma dang / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pas brdzun pa snang ba de dag don gyi bya ba cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir /

original: de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nang du 'du ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nang du 'du ba ma yin zhing /

original: don byed pa dang bral du zin kyang spyi'i nang du 'du ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa dang bral du zin kyang spyi'i nang du 'du ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And even though they are devoid of the function of a real object, they are not included within the general.

original: gsal bar so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / la lar rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / la lar rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul du mi 'du ba'i phyir de yul gzhan ma yin pas na /

original: yul rnam pa gnyis rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul rnam pa gnyis rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not illogical.

original: 'di ltar skra shad la sogs don min no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skra shad la sogs don min no //
translated: Because floating hairs and so on are not objects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: don du mos pa med phyir ro //

original: don dam par spyi yul ma yin du zin kyang tha snyad 'dogs pa po'i de'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa can 'jug par 'gyur ba de bas na de yul nyid yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par spyi yul ma yin du zin kyang tha snyad 'dogs pa po'i de'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa can 'jug par 'gyur ba de bas na de yul nyid yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Although ultimately it is not an object of the universal, it is the object of the one who is attached to the entity of the nominalizer. Therefore, it is established as the object.

original: sbyor ba yang skyes bu rnams gang la shes pa gang gis yul gyi ngo bo nyid du mos pa med pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang skyes bu rnams gang la shes pa gang gis yul gyi ngo bo nyid du mos pa med pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever object is not conceived as the nature of an object by a certain cognition,

original: shes pa de'i yul gyi tha snyad 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de'i yul gyi tha snyad 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: the convention of the object does not apply to it by means of that cognition.

original: dper na shes pa de nyid kyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes pa de nyid kyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the aspect of the apprehender by that cognition itself.

original: rab rib can la sogs pas dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams don nyid du mos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
